quotes.text: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: Love is always being given where it is not required.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.text: Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art; it is the part the schools cannot recognize.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.text: When you laugh, laugh like hell. And when you get angry, get good and angry. Try to be alive. You will be dead soon enough.
quotes.author: William Saroyan

quotes.text: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
quotes.author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

quotes.text: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  The Taming of the Shrew

quotes.text: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.
quotes.author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,  Obsidian

quotes.text: Happiness [is] only real when shared
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

quotes.text: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.
quotes.author: Mo Willems,  Goldilocks and the Three Dinosaurs

quotes.text: Do what your inner soul tells you to do, regardless of any money or success it will bring you.
quotes.author: Etel Adnan

quotes.text: Hope is in the name of God, the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Hope is when you compare your suffering to the infinite, immeasurable love and grace of God.
quotes.author: Nick Vujicic

quotes.text: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?
quotes.author: Emily Bronte

quotes.text: I can imagine no more comfortable frame of mind for the conduct of life than a humorous resignation.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.text: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
quotes.author: Marcus Garvey

quotes.text: Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest people uneasy is the best bred in the room.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.text: Truth only means something when it's hard to admit.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song

quotes.text: I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quotes.text: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
quotes.author: Margaret Walker

quotes.text: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

quotes.text: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quotes.text: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.text: Fighting for one's freedom, struggling towards being free, is like struggling to be a poet or a good Christian or a good Jew or a good Muslim or good Zen Buddhist. You work all day long and achieve some kind of level of success by nightfall, go to sleep and wake up the next morning with the job still to be done. So you start all over again.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: If you don't like me, life goes on, you know what I mean? But I hope you do like me. Because I think that in addition to being pushy, I'm nice.
quotes.author: Christine Quinn

quotes.text: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.text: Life began with waking up and loving my mother's face.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.text: Love is the child of illusion and the parent of disillusion.
quotes.author: Miguel de Unamuno

quotes.text: The work of art, just like any fragment of human life considered in its deepest meaning, seems to me devoid of value if it does not offer the hardness, the rigidity, the regularity, the luster on every interior and exterior facet, of the crystal.
quotes.author: Pope Paul VI

quotes.text: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Self Reliance

quotes.text: I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.text: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
quotes.author: François Mauriac

quotes.text: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck,  The Grapes of Wrath

quotes.text: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, the Places You'll Go! and The Lorax

quotes.text: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.text: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
quotes.author: Bette Midler

quotes.text: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
quotes.author: David Levithan,  Will Grayson, Will Grayson

quotes.text: Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut,  A Man Without a Country

quotes.text: When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes

quotes.text: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
quotes.author: P.C. Cast,  Betrayed

quotes.text: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: There are millions of Americans outside Washington who are tired of stale political arguments and are moving this country forward. They believe, and I believe, that here in America, our success should depend not on accident of birth, but the strength of our work ethic and the scope of our dreams.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: So many times I've photographed stories that show the degradation of the planet. I had one idea to go and photograph the factories that were polluting, and to see all the deposits of garbage. But, in the end, I thought the only way to give us an incentive, to bring hope, is to show the pictures of the pristine planet - to see the innocence.
quotes.author: Sebastiao Salgado

quotes.text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: Analyzing humor is like dissecting a frog. Few people are interested and the frog dies of it.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.text: Our parents deserve our honor and respect for giving us life itself. Beyond this they almost always made countless sacrifices as they cared for and nurtured us through our infancy and childhood, provided us with the necessities of life, and nursed us through physical illnesses and the emotional stresses of growing up.
quotes.author: Ezra Taft Benson

quotes.text: There is no limit to the power of loving.
quotes.author: John Morton

quotes.text: History repeats itself, but the special call of an art which has passed away is never reproduced. It is as utterly gone out of the world as the song of a destroyed wild bird.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.text: Winter is coming.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin,  A Game of Thrones

quotes.text: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
quotes.author: Michael Ondaatje,  The English Patient

quotes.text: Love is the absence of judgment.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.text: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
quotes.author: Umberto Eco,  The Name of the Rose

quotes.text: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.
quotes.author: John Grisham,  The Rainmaker

quotes.text: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing

quotes.text: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: No matter how much suffering you went through, you never wanted to let go of those memories.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.text: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The negative side of the American Dream comes when people pursue success at any cost, which in turn destroys the vision and the dream.
quotes.author: Azar Nafisi

quotes.text: I was close to getting married a long time ago. But it didn't happen, and since then it has not been happening. It is jinxed, and I am very happy. I hope this jinx continues.
quotes.author: Salman Khan

quotes.text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: A laugh is a surprise. And all humor is physical. I was always athletic, so that came naturally to me.
quotes.author: Chevy Chase

quotes.text: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
quotes.author: Meister Eckhart

quotes.text: The cure for all the ills and wrongs, the cares, the sorrows, and the crimes of humanity, all lie in the one word 'love'. It is the divine vitality that everywhere produces and restores life.
quotes.author: Lydia M. Child

quotes.text: Encouraging young people to believe in themselves and find their own voice whether it's through writing, drama or art is so important in giving young people a sense of self-worth.
quotes.author: Michael Morpurgo

quotes.text: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: So many things become beautiful when you really look.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall

quotes.text: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.
quotes.author: Bill Cosby

quotes.text: My soul will find yours.
quotes.author: Jude Deveraux,  A Knight in Shining Armor

quotes.text: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  Horton Hatches the Egg

quotes.text: Even the strongest and bravest must sometimes weep. It shows they have a great heart, one that can feel compassion for others.
quotes.author: Brian Jacques,  Redwall

quotes.text: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
quotes.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quotes.text: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  How the Grinch Stole Christmas!

quotes.text: Be passionate and bold. Always keep learning. You stop doing useful things if you don't learn. So the last part to me is the key, especially if you have had some initial success. It becomes even more critical that you have the learning 'bit' always switched on.
quotes.author: Satya Nadella

quotes.text: Part of me really wants to believe that hope is entirely available to all of us. We don't have to embrace it. It would be sentimental and silly to say that we all need it, but it is absolutely available to all of us.
quotes.author: Colum McCann

quotes.text: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
quotes.author: Harbhajan Singh

quotes.text: Humor is the instinct for taking pain playfully.
quotes.author: Max Eastman

quotes.text: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: But love's a malady without a cure.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.text: I don't listen to what art critics say. I don't know anybody who needs a critic to find out what art is.
quotes.author: Jean-Michel Basquiat

quotes.text: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
quotes.author: Desmond Tutu

quotes.text: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne,  Winnie-the-Pooh

quotes.text: The past has no power over the present moment.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.text: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
quotes.author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

quotes.text: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: As if you were on fire from within.The moon lives in the lining of your skin.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda

quotes.text: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quotes.text: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Vampire Academy

quotes.text: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

quotes.text: Change can either challenge or threaten us. Your beliefs pave your way to success or block you.
quotes.author: Marsha Sinetar

quotes.text: When I see myself on film it makes me smile, I mean making a good living doing what I enjoy is soo much fun. I just hope that everyone has the chance to enjoy life like I do.
quotes.author: Adrienne Barbeau

quotes.text: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
quotes.author: Robert Southey

quotes.text: Honest good humor is the oil and wine of a merry meeting, and there is no jovial companionship equal to that where the jokes are rather small and laughter abundant.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.text: Life is not easy for any of us. But what of that? We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something and that this thing must be attained.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.text: I don't believe in the school of hard knocks, although I've had them. All that stuff about whatever doesn't kill you makes you stronger is so not true. Do you know what makes you stronger? When people treat you and your art with dignity.
quotes.author: Lana Del Rey

quotes.text: Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.some lose both and become accepted
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.
quotes.author: S.E. Hinton,  The Outsiders

quotes.text: People change and forget to tell each other.
quotes.author: Lillian Hellman

quotes.text: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

quotes.text: I must have loved you a lot.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

quotes.text: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra,  When You Come to a Fork in the Road, Take It!: Inspiration and Wisdom from One of Baseball's Greatest Heroes

quotes.text: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: We write in ways that, we generally hope, reflect real life, or at least look familiar to humans. And in life, recurring themes are a recurring theme. We never quite conquer a pet vice or a relationship pattern or a communication habit. We're haunted by our particular demons.
quotes.author: Sara Zarr

quotes.text: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
quotes.author: Marie de France

quotes.text: Humor is emotional chaos remembered in tranquility.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.text: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: Death be not proud, though some have called thee Mighty and dreadful, for thou art not so. For, those, whom thou think'st thou dost overthrow. Die not, poor death, nor yet canst thou kill me.
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.text: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
quotes.author: Alan W. Watts

quotes.text: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking-Glass

quotes.text: Remember if people talk behind your back, it only means you are two steps ahead.
quotes.author: Fannie Flagg,  Fried Green Tomatoes at the Whistle Stop Cafe

quotes.text: She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  Stardust

quotes.text: Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way.
quotes.author: Stanisław Lem

quotes.text: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Wilhelm Meister's Apprenticeship

quotes.text: People come, people go – they’ll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Rescue

quotes.text: Reading brings us unknown friends
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.text: The world was hers for the reading.
quotes.author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

quotes.text: A house without books is like a room without windows.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.text: If God has made the world a perfect mechanism, He has at least conceded so much to our imperfect intellect that in order to predict little parts of it, we need not solve innumerable differential equations, but can use dice with fair success.
quotes.author: Max Born

quotes.text: We tell them that we believe it will be beautiful because that is our specialty, we only create joy and beauty. We have never done a sad work. Through the drawings, we hope a majority will be able to visualize it.
quotes.author: Christo

quotes.text: The joys of friendship inert the heart and fizzy home bouncing jubilantly with laughter-buttered love.
quotes.author: Bradley Chicho

quotes.text: To me, sadness and humor aren't disrelated and humor is the best tool I've had against the sadness in my life.
quotes.author: Mike Mills

quotes.text: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.text: A painter, who finds no satisfaction in mere representation, however artistic, in his longing to express his inner life, cannot but envy the ease with which music, the most non-material of the arts today, achieves this end. He naturally seeks to apply the methods of music to his own art.
quotes.author: Wassily Kandinsky

quotes.text: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.
quotes.author: W.C. Fields

quotes.text: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.
quotes.author: Henry Miller,  The Books in My Life

quotes.text: Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.
quotes.author: Thomas Wolfe,  You Can't Go Home Again

quotes.text: When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde,  Lady Windermere's Fan

quotes.text: The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear
quotes.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quotes.text: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
quotes.author: A.A. Milne

quotes.text: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski,  Love is a Dog from Hell

quotes.text: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.
quotes.author: Nick Hornby

quotes.text: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: You can't stop the futureYou can't rewind the pastThe only way to learn the secret...is to press play.
quotes.author: Jay Asher,  Thirteen Reasons Why

quotes.text: When I talk to people in need, they tell me they want to hope; they are eager for opportunity; they are ready for better days. And I can tell you that every time their hopes are disappointed, all nations lose.
quotes.author: Abdallah II of Jordan

quotes.text: No doubt, the most important thing in my career was my time with Mr. Bergman, with whom I worked in so many films and also in so many stage productions, so it was a continuous working relationship and also a friendship, of course, that lasted for so many years.
quotes.author: Max von Sydow

quotes.text: Humor and seriousness are not in opposition to each other.
quotes.author: Al Franken

quotes.text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
quotes.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quotes.text: I think vampires are different from human beings, but they're sentenced to eternity on this planet. They have the same confusion about love and permanence, integrity, and denial. These qualities really are the same in vampire characters as in humans. I think they're universal themes.
quotes.author: Alexandra Cassavetes

quotes.text: There are so many opportunities in life, that the loss of two or three capabilities is not necessarily debilitating. A handicap can give you the opportunity to focus more on art, writing, or music.
quotes.author: Jim Davis

quotes.text: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
quotes.author: Stephanie Perkins,  Anna and the French Kiss

quotes.text: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston,  Their Eyes Were Watching God

quotes.text: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
quotes.author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Speak

quotes.text: I care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: I am a cage, in search of a bird.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
quotes.author: Charles Lamb,  The Life, Letters and Writings of Charles Lamb

quotes.text: It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.
quotes.author: W.G. Sebald,  Vertigo

quotes.text: People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Wave in the Mind: Talks & Essays on the Writer, the Reader & the Imagination

quotes.text: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag

quotes.text: In a time of destruction, create something.
quotes.author: Maxine Hong Kingston

quotes.text: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.
quotes.author: Lauren Kate,  Torment

quotes.text: It is never too late to be wise.
quotes.author: Daniel Defoe,  Robinson Crusoe

quotes.text: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

quotes.text: We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quotes.text: Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.Jace on the other hand, looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house and burn it down just for kicks.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

quotes.text: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quotes.text: Success isn't permanent and failure isn't fatal.
quotes.author: Mike Ditka

quotes.text: It is in vain to hope to please all alike. Let a man stand with his face in what direction he will, he must necessarily turn his back on one half of the world.
quotes.author: George Dennison Prentice

quotes.text: My reputation is too important to put it aside for purposes of some friendship. We have a job to do.
quotes.author: Stephanie Tubbs Jones

quotes.text: The line between humor and bad taste is your audience, in which some people will find everything offensive, and some people will find nothing offensive, but the truth is that most humor originates in what would be called bad taste.
quotes.author: Robert Mankoff

quotes.text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: My secret indulgent food is dessert. I have an incredible sweet tooth - chocolate pudding with vanilla ice-cream or trifle and pavlova. I do love dessert.
quotes.author: Deborra-Lee Furness

quotes.text: Fine art is knowledge made visible.
quotes.author: Gustave Courbet

quotes.text: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

quotes.text: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
quotes.author: Phyllis Diller

quotes.text: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.
quotes.author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quotes.text: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?
quotes.author: Stephanie Perkins,  Anna and the French Kiss

quotes.text: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
quotes.author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi

quotes.text: What do I care about the purring of one who cannot love, like the cat?

quotes.text: Glory is a heavy burden, a murdering poison, and to bear it is an art. And to have that art is rare.

quotes.text: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.

quotes.text: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.

quotes.text: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.

quotes.text: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.

quotes.text: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.

quotes.text: I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.

quotes.text: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.

quotes.text: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.

quotes.text: Religion is a complex and often contradictory force in our world. It fosters hope and comfort but also doubt and guilt. It creates both community and exclusion. quotes.text: Likings arise when one has no earthly reason for liking - the most wildly improbable marriages and uncommon friendship.

quotes.text: I'm not ashamed to be me. More than anyone else I know, I love my life and accept myself. What's wrong with being unique? I am proud of everything that I am and will become.

quotes.text: Ask any successful person to look back over the events of his or her life, and chances are there'll be a turning point of one kind or another. It doesn't matter if that success has come on a ball field or in a boardroom, in a research laboratory or on a campaign trail - it can usually be traced to some pivotal moment.

quotes.text: It is sound judgment to hope that in the not too distant future we shall be competent to understand so simple a thing as a star.

quotes.text: I despise shows that present friendship where you're always there for each other and really strong because I don't know anyone like that. I mean, I've got great friends, but I can go months without seeing them because I think, 'I just can't deal with having to give you anything.'

quotes.text: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.

quotes.text: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without the thorn.

quotes.text: Do not read as children do to enjoy themselves, or, as the ambitious do to educate themselves. No, read to live.

quotes.text: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.

quotes.text: I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

quotes.text: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.

quotes.text: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.

quotes.text: I hope the wonder of what happens to my characters never goes away. That yearning keeps me writing.

quotes.text: When it comes to Pakistan, the first word that comes to the mind of the Chinese is 'iron brother.' To us Chinese, Pakistan is always a trustworthy friend who is as solid as iron. Actually, Chinese netizens refer to Pakistan as 'Iron Pak.' This testifies to the strength of China-Pakistan friendship.
quotes.author: Li Keqiang

quotes.text: Well, darkness with humor... I'm not an extremely suicidal or sad person.

quotes.text: A party without cake is just a meeting

quotes.text: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.

quotes.text: Knock, And He'll open the doorVanish, And He'll make you shine like the sunFall, And He'll raise you to the heavensBecome nothing, And He'll turn you into everything.

quotes.text: You can have it all. Just not all at once.

quotes.text: Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.

'That Wasn't Me' is no exception - it came together more quickly than any other song I have ever constructed on my own.

quotes.text: Humor is the truth; wit is an exaggeration of the truth.

quotes.text: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.

quotes.text: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.

quotes.text: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.

quotes.text: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.

quotes.text: In order to riseFrom its own ashesA phoenixFirstMustBurn.

quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quotes.text: I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you’ll take me in your arms again.

quotes.text: Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.

quotes.text: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: you have to love something before you can hate it.

quotes.text: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.
quotes.author: Mark Twain,  The Innocents Abroad/Roughing It

quotes.text: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

quotes.text: To put it bluntly, there isn't one economic theory that can single-handedly explain Singapore's success; its economy combines extreme features of capitalism and socialism. All theories are partial; reality is complex.

quotes.text: America stands as a beacon of hope and the possibility of a better life - but it is also a nation where nearly 1 in 4 children live in poverty.
quotes.author: Chris Van Hollen

quotes.text: This airline is grateful for his extensive contributions and we will miss his friendship and support. We extend our deepest sympathies to the Casey family on its personal loss.
quotes.author: Gerard Arpey

quotes.text: A woman who knows that she doesn't have to get all decked out to look good is sexy. A woman who can make you feel smart with her conversation skills is also sexy. I believe the sense of humor is important.
quotes.author: Benedict Cumberbatch

quotes.text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.

quotes.text: The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake.

quotes.text: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
quotes.author: Charles Lamb

quotes.text: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.
quotes.author: William Golding,  Lord of the Flies

quotes.text: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.

quotes.text: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.
quotes.author: Stieg Larsson,  The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

quotes.text: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

quotes.text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.

quotes.text: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.

quotes.text: This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature.
quotes.author: Julian Barnes,  The Sense of an Ending

quotes.text: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Nothing great in the world was accomplished without passion.
quotes.author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quotes.text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
quotes.author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quotes.text: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.

quotes.text: Thus they have an idol that they petition for victory in war; another for success in their labors; and so for everything in which they seek or desire prosperity, they have their idols, which they honor and serve.

quotes.text: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.

quotes.text: I think what motivates people is not great hate, but great love for other people.
quotes.author: Huey Newton

quotes.text: Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.

quotes.text: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
quotes.author: J.M. Barrie,  Peter Pan

quotes.text: A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.

quotes.text: Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer,  New Moon

quotes.text: I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song

quotes.text: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.
quotes.author: Hal Borland

quotes.text: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.

quotes.text: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.
quotes.author: Jo Walton,  Among Others

quotes.text: I drink to make other people more interesting.
