quotes.text: I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  This Side of Paradise

quotes.text: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.text: you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
quotes.author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quotes.text: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.text: But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.
quotes.author: Anne Brontë

quotes.text: I have had unsuccessful films, but I learned a lot from those films. I give my failures as much importance as my success.
quotes.author: Aamir Khan

quotes.text: I think that everybody needs four things in life. Everybody needs something to do regardless of age. Everybody needs someone to love. Everybody needs something to hope for, and, of course, everybody needs someone to believe in.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.text: I think faith helps me a lot. God wants you to be where He wants you to be, and that's where I want to be. If I do not get a part, I understand that maybe I needed to be home at that time, maybe in school; there's always a reason. My faith is also where my core friends are, at my church, a faith-based friendship.
quotes.author: Jason Dolley

quotes.text: The first ingredient in conversation is truth, the next good sense, the third good humor, and the fourth wit.
quotes.author: William Temple

quotes.text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
quotes.author: Omar Khayyam

quotes.text: Women in love are less ashamed than men. They have less to be ashamed of.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.text: Errors are not in the art but in the artificers.
quotes.author: Isaac Newton

quotes.text: Have you really read all those books in your room?”Alaska laughing- “Oh God no. I’ve maybe read a third of ‘em. But I’m going to read them all. I call it my Life’s Library. Every summer since I was little, I’ve gone to garage sales and bought all the books that looked interesting. So I always have something to read.
quotes.author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

quotes.text: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quotes.text: If everybody is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.
quotes.author: George S. Patton Jr.

quotes.text: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.
quotes.author: Brian Andreas,  Story People: Selected Stories & Drawings of Brian Andreas

quotes.text: Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them.
quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind

quotes.text: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quotes.text: The most painful thing is losing yourself in the process of loving someone too much, and forgetting that you are special too.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway,  Men Without Women

quotes.text: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

quotes.text: In the endthese things matter most:How well did you love?How fully did you live?How deeply did you let go?
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.
quotes.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quotes.text: You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written — behind your silence and your suffering.
quotes.author: Anne Rice

quotes.text: I'd rather die my way than live yours.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

quotes.text: Sometimes things fall apart so that better things can fall together
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: The world is apt to judge of everything by the success; and whoever has ill fortune will hardly be allowed a good name.
quotes.author: William Dampier

quotes.text: The hope of eternal life is not to be taken up upon slight grounds. It is a subject to be settled between God and your own soul; settled for eternity. A supposed hope, and nothing more, will prove your ruin.
quotes.author: Ellen G. White

quotes.text: Richard Donner's friendship and guidance showed me that there's more to life than being an actor.
quotes.author: Jeff Cohen

quotes.text: There's a certain type of character that you can't help but come in contact with growing up and living in Brooklyn and Long Island. A certain mixture of moxie, heart, and a wise guy sense of humor.
quotes.author: Steve Buscemi

quotes.text: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.text: I love the confidence that makeup gives me.
quotes.author: Tyra Banks

quotes.text: Emotion resulting from a work of art is only of value when it is not obtained by sentimental blackmail.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.
quotes.author: P.C. Cast

quotes.text: But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood

quotes.text: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.
quotes.author: Joseph Heller,  Catch-22

quotes.text: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.
quotes.author: Kate DiCamillo,  The Miraculous Journey of Edward Tulane

quotes.text: Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.
quotes.author: Terry McMillan,  Disappearing Acts

quotes.text: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
quotes.author: Nikolai Gogol

quotes.text: The helpful thought for which you lookIs written somewhere in a book.
quotes.author: Edward Gorey

quotes.text: Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.
quotes.author: Danielle Steel,  The Gift

quotes.text: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.text: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.text: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

quotes.text: When I meet successful people I ask 100 questions as to what they attribute their success to. It is usually the same: persistence, hard work and hiring good people.
quotes.author: Kiana Tom

quotes.text: A radical inner transformation and rise to a new level of consciousness might be the only real hope we have in the current global crisis brought on by the dominance of the Western mechanistic paradigm.
quotes.author: Stanislav Grof

quotes.text: Here's a news flash: No soldier gives his life. That's not the way it works. Most soldiers who make a conscious decision to place themselves in harm's way do it to protect their buddies. They do it because of the bonds of friendship - and it goes so much deeper than friendship.
quotes.author: Eric Massa

quotes.text: Americans are pragmatic, relatively uncomplicated, hearty and given to broad humor.
quotes.author: Herb Caen

quotes.text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.text: I love food, all types of food. I love Korean food, Japanese, Italian, French. In Australia, we don't have a distinctive Australian food, so we have food from everywhere all around the world. We're very multicultural, so we grew up with lots of different types of food.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: Art and religion first; then philosophy; lastly science. That is the order of the great subjects of life, that's their order of importance.
quotes.author: Muriel Spark

quotes.text: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables

quotes.text: If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.
quotes.author: Steve Wozniak

quotes.text: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.
quotes.author: William Blake,  Auguries of Innocence

quotes.text: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Sea of Monsters

quotes.text: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.text: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: A library is infinity under a roof.
quotes.author: Gail Carson Levine

quotes.text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: Black holes are where God divided by zero.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Success is not to be pursued; it is to be attracted by the person you become.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: I think it's a mistake to ever look for hope outside of one's self.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.text: When the bank asks me about my assets, I include my friendship with Regis Philbin.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.text: I'd probably describe my sense of humor as 'twisted,' I guess. It's not hard to make me laugh, especially when I'm surrounded by my close friends, especially my bandmates.
quotes.author: Mac DeMarco

quotes.text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.text: The only creatures that are evolved enough to convey pure love are dogs and infants.
quotes.author: Johnny Depp

quotes.text: All I tell artists is, 'Do what you love. Never let anybody talk you into changing what your musical idea is just to try to get a hit, because you're chasing your tail that way. It's not going to happen, and if you're successful, you have to do it the rest of your life. Stay true to it and do it for the sake of the art.'
quotes.author: Gloria Estefan

quotes.text: And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket,  Horseradish

quotes.text: Where words leave off, music begins.
quotes.author: Heinrich Heine

quotes.text: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quotes.text: Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

quotes.text: Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.
quotes.author: Guy de Maupassant

quotes.text: One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.
quotes.author: Katharine Graham

quotes.text: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.
quotes.author: Lev Grossman,  The Magicians

quotes.text: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.
quotes.author: Emma Donoghue,  Room

quotes.text: Success is not built on success. It's built on failure. It's built on frustration. Sometimes its built on catastrophe.
quotes.author: Sumner Redstone

quotes.text: There will always be a place for us somewhere, somehow, as long as we see to it that working people fight for everything they have, everything they hope to get, for dignity, equality, democracy, to oppose war and to bring to the world a better life.
quotes.author: Harry Bridges

quotes.text: As told in Friendship with God, if we simply decided to believe and act as if first, we're all one, and second, life is eternal, it would render virtually everything we've done all our lives pointless.
quotes.author: Neale Donald Walsch

quotes.text: Humor has justly been regarded as the finest perfection of poetic genius.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.text: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.
quotes.author: Matt Cameron

quotes.text: I don't know if One Direction will stand the test of time. I have a niece who goes crazy for them. But the only way to judge art is to wait and see if it becomes evergreen. This takes a bit of time. Adele is a very good musician and I'd like to sing with her. But, again, time will tell if her music will become evergreen.
quotes.author: Andrea Bocelli

quotes.text: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

quotes.text: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.text: No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.Well, get used to that feeling. That's how your whole life will feel some day.This is all practice.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

quotes.text: Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.text: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.
quotes.author: R.A. Salvatore,  Sojourn

quotes.text: If I’m honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.
quotes.author: Donald E. Westlake,  Two Much

quotes.text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: The making of friends who are real friends, is the best token we have of a man's success in life.
quotes.author: Edward Everett Hale

quotes.text: I hope we will not so characterize religious people as being so narrow and so biased towards people not of their own religion that they cannot even work with them in this common cause to which you say they are committed.
quotes.author: Barney Frank

quotes.text: I experience for the American officers and soldiers that friendship which arises from having shared with them for a length of time dangers, sufferings, and both good and evil fortune.
quotes.author: Marquis de Lafayette

quotes.text: Having a sense of humor has served me more than it has hurt me - just in the sense that it has allowed me to keep my sanity.
quotes.author: Dee Dee Myers

quotes.text: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
quotes.author: Ron White

quotes.text: In the film world, we can all be heroes. In the real world, where heroism can cost you your life or the life of the ones you love, people aren't so willing to make those sacrifices. When they do, they are set apart from the rest of us.
quotes.author: John Rhys-Davies

quotes.text: Simplicity, clarity, singleness: These are the attributes that give our lives power and vividness and joy as they are also the marks of great art. They seem to be the purpose of God for his whole creation.
quotes.author: Richard Holloway

quotes.text: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
quotes.author: Eoin Colfer,  Artemis Fowl

quotes.text: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
quotes.author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quotes.text: The earth has music for those who listen.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.text: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
quotes.author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

quotes.text: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski,  Women

quotes.text: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.
quotes.author: Edward Abbey

quotes.text: It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.
quotes.author: Johnny Depp

quotes.text: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.
quotes.author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being

quotes.text: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Translations from the Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke

quotes.text: If you work just for money, you'll never make it, but if you love what you're doing and you always put the customer first, success will be yours.
quotes.author: Ray Kroc

quotes.text: 'Peace Train' is a song I wrote, the message of which continues to breeze thunderously through the hearts of millions. There is a powerful need for people to feel that gust of hope rise up again.
quotes.author: Cat Stevens

quotes.text: Never was a man further from a partiality for Spain than I am. But I think I now have left them in a sincere and steady intention to cultivate the friendship of America.
quotes.author: Marquis de Lafayette

quotes.text: Our subconscious minds have no sense of humor, play no jokes and cannot tell the difference between reality and an imagined thought or image. What we continually think about eventually will manifest in our lives.
quotes.author: Robert Collier

quotes.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: You should hurry up and acquire the cigar habit. It's one of the major happinesses. And so much more lasting than love, so much less costly in emotional wear and tear.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.text: My goal is to be one with the music. I just dedicate my whole life to this art.
quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

quotes.text: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: When I was your age, television was called books.
quotes.author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quotes.text: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
quotes.author: Steve Martin

quotes.text: Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  South of the Border, West of the Sun

quotes.text: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice in Wonderland

quotes.text: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.text: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.text: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Devil and Miss Prym

quotes.text: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.
quotes.author: Geraldine Brooks,  March

quotes.text: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream

quotes.text: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's sizeBut when I start to tell them,They think I'm telling lies.I say,It's in the reach of my armsThe span of my hips,The stride of my step,The curl of my lips.I'm a womanPhenomenally.Phenomenal woman,That's me.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou,  Phenomenal Woman: Four Poems Celebrating Women

quotes.text: Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.
quotes.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley,  The Forest House

quotes.text: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!
quotes.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay,  The Selected Letters Of Thomas Babington Macaulay

quotes.text: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
quotes.author: Joyce Carol Oates

quotes.text: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison,  Song of Solomon

quotes.text: We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

quotes.text: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.text: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

quotes.text: Problems or successes, they all are the results of our own actions. Karma. The philosophy of action is that no one else is the giver of peace or happiness. One's own karma, one's own actions are responsible to come to bring either happiness or success or whatever.
quotes.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

quotes.text: I would hope my legacy would be bringing smiles to faces. Happiness with my music.
quotes.author: Janet Jackson

quotes.text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
quotes.author: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.text: There is a collective as well as an individual humor inclining peoples to sadness or cheerfulness, making them see things in bright or somber lights. In fact, only society can pass a collective opinion on the value of human life; for this the individual is incompetent.
quotes.author: Emile Durkheim

quotes.text: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love colour the most.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.text: What an artist is trying to do for people is bring them closer to something, because of course art is about sharing. You wouldn't be an artist unless you wanted to share an experience, a thought.
quotes.author: David Hockney

quotes.text: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

quotes.text: Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.
quotes.author: E.Y. Harburg

quotes.text: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven

quotes.text: The darker the night, the brighter the stars,  The deeper the grief, the closer is God!
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  Crime and Punishment

quotes.text: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
quotes.author: David Henry Hwang,  M. Butterfly

quotes.text: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books. The book needs you.
quotes.author: Gary Paulsen,  The Winter Room

quotes.text: I guess that’s just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

quotes.text: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  Essays of Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Success comes to those who have an entire mountain of gold that they continually mine, not those who find one nugget and try to live on it for fifty years.
quotes.author: John C. Maxwell

quotes.text: All what we hope for is that a day will come, when we have all gone, when people will say that this man has tried, and his family tried. This is all there is to seek in this world.
quotes.author: King Hussein I

quotes.text: I find that the Amazon comments often are exceptionally shrewd and insightful, so I'm not going to diss them. But you don't really have any guarantees that what you're reading wasn't written out of friendship or spite.
quotes.author: Michael Dirda

quotes.text: Humor is not a mood but a way of looking at the world. So if it is correct to say that humor was stamped out in Nazi Germany, that does not mean that people were not in good spirits, or anything of that sort, but something much deeper and more important.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.text: There were times, especially when I was traveling for 'Eat, Pray, Love,' when, I swear to God, I would feel this weight of my female ancestors, all those Swedish farmwives from beyond the grave who were like, 'Go! Go to Naples! Eat more pizza! Go to India, ride an elephant! Do it! Swim in the Indian Ocean. Read those books. Learn a language.'
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.text: Madness is the absolute break with the work of art; it forms the constitutive moment of abolition, which dissolves in time the truth of the work of art.
quotes.author: Michel Foucault

quotes.text: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
quotes.author: Langston Hughes

quotes.text: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper

quotes.text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence
quotes.author: Bei Dao

quotes.text: You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Shadow Kiss

quotes.text: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  Three Weeks With My Brother

quotes.text: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Blood Promise

quotes.text: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

quotes.text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind

quotes.text: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.
quotes.author: Paula Poundstone

quotes.text: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Success is about dedication. You may not be where you want to be or do what you want to do when you're on the journey. But you've got to be willing to have vision and foresight that leads you to an incredible end.
quotes.author: Usher

quotes.text: I hope I look skinnier in 3D. I hope I don't look three times as fat. That'll be disappointing.
quotes.author: Kathy Bates

quotes.text: I firmly believe, only because I've been doing this for so long, every show takes three years. 90% of them don't get three years. It just does. It takes a long time to build a community, build a friendship with your characters. It's hard for people to grasp on and make them care about you.
quotes.author: Kaley Cuoco

quotes.text: The reason why you know more funny dudes than funny chicks is that dudes are funnier than chicks. If my daughter has a mediocre sense of humor, I'm just gonna tell her, 'Be a staff writer for a sitcom. Because they'll have to hire you, they can't really fire you, and you don't have to produce that much. It'll be awesome.'
quotes.author: Adam Carolla

quotes.text: We provide food that customers love, day after day after day. People just want more of it.
quotes.author: Ray Kroc

quotes.text: If you don't get noticed, you don't have anything. You just have to be noticed, but the art is in getting noticed naturally, without screaming or without tricks.
quotes.author: Leo Burnett

quotes.text: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.
quotes.author: Melissa Marr,  Ink Exchange

quotes.text: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.
quotes.author: Jim Butcher

quotes.text: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.
quotes.author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Awakened

quotes.text: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut,  The Sirens of Titan

quotes.text: Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.
quotes.author: Guy de Maupassant

quotes.text: I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent

quotes.text: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.
quotes.author: Anne Rice,  Interview with the Vampire

quotes.text: They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: My library is an archive of longings.
quotes.author: Susan Sontag,  As Consciousness is Harnessed to Flesh: Journals and Notebooks, 1964-1980

quotes.text: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.
quotes.author: John Updike,  My Father's Tears and Other Stories

quotes.text: To put everything in balance is good, to put everything in harmony is better.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: A person has to remember that the road to success is always under construction. You have to get that through your head. That it is not easy becoming successful.
quotes.author: Steve Harvey

quotes.text: There was a time when I thought dudes had friendship all figured out. The focus on eating things in front of giant screens, pretending to punch one another, competing over who can utter the grossest and most profane personal insults imaginable - this struck me as the very apex of human social exchange.
quotes.author: Lynn Coady

quotes.text: A book without potty humor is like a banana split without hot fudge. It can still be good, I suppose, but you kinda get the feeling that something is missing.
quotes.author: Dav Pilkey

quotes.text: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.text: We adore chaos because we love to produce order.
quotes.author: M. C. Escher

quotes.text: As far as playing jazz, no other art form, other than conversation, can give the satisfaction of spontaneous interaction.
quotes.author: Stan Getz

quotes.text: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.text: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  Travels with a Donkey in the Cevennes

quotes.text: By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth

quotes.text: It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting.
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket,  The Grim Grotto

quotes.text: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
quotes.author: Pat Monahan

quotes.text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

quotes.text: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quotes.text: You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...
quotes.author: Keri Hulme,  The Bone People

quotes.text: Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quotes.text: There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.text: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
quotes.author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Unbecoming of Mara Dyer

quotes.text: A lot of you cared, just not enough.
quotes.author: Jay Asher,  Thirteen Reasons Why

quotes.text: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.
quotes.author: Peter Shaffer,  Five Finger Exercise: A Play

quotes.text: The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success.
quotes.author: Bruce Feirstein

quotes.text: Many believe - and I believe - that I have been designated for this work by God. In spite of my old age, I do not want to give it up; I work out of love for God and I put all my hope in Him.
quotes.author: Michelangelo

quotes.text: If Reagan had intelligence information that showed that the upheaval in Egypt is actually Democratic in spirit, then he would have, I believe, turned his back on Mubarak, even though there's a long friendship between the United States and Egypt.
quotes.author: Douglas Brinkley

quotes.text: I love practical jokes and humor. That there's frankly no joke that I don't think is funny. I love practical jokes, but I don't like being scared.
quotes.author: Mitt Romney

quotes.text: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: I don't like any kind of negativity. I try to be good to everyone, whether it's a love, a friend, an ex. I'll always try to treat people the way I want to be treated.
quotes.author: Nina Dobrev

quotes.text: We should always remember that sensitiveness and emotion constitute the real content of a work of art.
quotes.author: Maurice Ravel

quotes.text: Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love. It did not end well.
quotes.author: Laini Taylor,  Daughter of Smoke & Bone

quotes.text: My course is set for an uncharted sea.
quotes.author: Dante Alighieri

quotes.text: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.
quotes.author: Tahereh Mafi,  Shatter Me

quotes.text: I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.

quotes.text: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.
quotes.author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta

quotes.text: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: Be glad. Be good. Be brave.
quotes.author: Eleanor H. Porter

quotes.text: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.
quotes.author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkheart

quotes.text: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  At First Sight

quotes.text: That which you believe becomes your world.
quotes.author: Richard Matheson,  What Dreams May Come

quotes.text: Only you can control your future.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.
quotes.author: Peter S. Beagle,  The Last Unicorn

quotes.text: Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.
quotes.author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades of Grey

quotes.text: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. She only looked away for a moment, and the mask slipped, and you fell. All your tomorrows start here.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  Fragile Things: Short Fictions and Wonders

quotes.text: I feel like I want to take care of everyone and I also feel this terrible guilt if I am unable to. And I have felt this way ever since all this success started.
quotes.author: Jim Carrey

quotes.text: A man must love a thing very much if he not only practices it without any hope of fame and money, but even... without any hope of doing it well.

quotes.text: I think for a lot of people, friendship is a relationship that gets devalued once they move on to what people consider to be more important relationships: once you find a partner or when you have kids.
quotes.author: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.text: Cynicism is humor in ill health.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.text: Bad things do happen; how I respond to them defines my character and the quality of my life. I can choose to sit in perpetual sadness, immobilized by the gravity of my loss, or I can choose to rise from the pain and treasure the most precious gift I have - life itself.

quotes.text: Bring love and peace and happiness and beautiful lives into the world in my honor. Thank you. Love you.
quotes.author: Aron Ralston

quotes.text: I'm a big illustration and comic book fan. In my eyes, comic books and illustration are the same kind of art forms.
quotes.author: Mika

quotes.text: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett,  Lords and Ladies

quotes.text: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
quotes.author: John Green,  Paper Towns

quotes.text: If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
quotes.author: Conan O'Brien

quotes.text: All great and precious things are lonely.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden

quotes.text: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw,  Man and Superman

quotes.text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams,  The Glass Menagerie

quotes.text: Starting a business isn't for everyone, and it's not what you should do if you aren't sure what else to do. It requires thick skin and the willingness to carry a great deal of stress, sometimes alone. It's more often a life of failure than a life of success, and the majority of successes came after a long road of disappointment, and often shame.
quotes.author: Kathryn Minshew

quotes.text: Bottom up thinkers try to start from experience and move from experience to understanding. They don't start with certain general principles they think beforehand are likely to be true; they just hope to find out what reality is like.
quotes.author: John Polkinghorne

quotes.text: In a basic sense, 'A Little Life' is a homage to how my friends and I live our lives. I wanted to push past the definitions of how we typically define friendship. It's a different version of adulthood, but it's no less important and no less legitimate than anyone else's.
quotes.author: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.text: You have to have a sense of humor about life to get through it.
quotes.author: Kesha

quotes.text: My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.text: I cannot say for certain if there is such a thing as love at first sight, but I do know that the moment I first glimpsed Winnie Nomzamo, I knew that I wanted to have her as my wife.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: I love to bring humour into my work. Because comedy is not a huge part of the art world. And big-business film takes itself very seriously.
quotes.author: James Franco

quotes.text: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

quotes.text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: You’re dangerous,” he says.“Why?”“Because you make me believe in the impossible
quotes.author: Simone Elkeles,  Rules of Attraction

quotes.text: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.
quotes.author: Kurt Cobain

quotes.text: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
quotes.author: Jane Yolen,  Touch Magic: Fantasy, Faerie & Folklore in the Literature of Childhood

quotes.text: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Slaughterhouse-Five

quotes.text: I am only responsible for my own heart, you offered yours up for the smashing my darling. Only a fool would give out such a vital organ
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

quotes.text: If I am really a part of your dream, you'll come back one day.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.
quotes.author: James Burke

quotes.text: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
quotes.author: Pittacus Lore,  I Am Number Four

quotes.text: Maybe who we are isn't so much about what we do, but rather what we're capable of when we least expect it.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper

quotes.text: Creative risk taking is essential to success in any goal where the stakes are high. Thoughtless risks are destructive, of course, but perhaps even more wasteful is thoughtless caution which prompts inaction and promotes failure to seize opportunity.
quotes.author: Gary Ryan Blair

quotes.text: Yeah, I miss it. You don't just break off a friendship you've had with a sport, and with all those you've met all over the country. We've got some friends, some very close friends, and you just sit back and think how fortunate you were having a career like that. And, actually, there's nothing in the game of baseball that hasn't happened to me.
quotes.author: Lou Boudreau

quotes.text: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: A sense of humor... is needed armor. Joy in one's heart and some laughter on one's lips is a sign that the person down deep has a pretty good grasp of life.
quotes.author: Hugh Sidey

quotes.text: Difficult times always create opportunities for you to experience more love in your life.
quotes.author: Barbara de Angelis

quotes.text: I don't get high, but sometimes I wish I did. That way, when I messed up in life I would have an excuse. But right now there's no rehab for stupidity.
quotes.author: Chris Rock

quotes.text: Nude nail polish wins hands down over intricate nail art.
quotes.author: Ashley Madekwe

quotes.text: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
quotes.author: Caroline Gordon

quotes.text: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
quotes.author: Emilie Autumn,  The Asylum for Wayward Victorian Girls

quotes.text: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine,  Fables

quotes.text: I’m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.
quotes.author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quotes.text: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
quotes.author: Molière

quotes.text: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
quotes.author: Beatrix Potter

quotes.text: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quotes.text: People talk about bullying, but you can be your own bully in some ways. You can be the person who is standing in the way of your success, and that was the case for me.
quotes.author: Katy Perry

quotes.text: I think people just like seeing friendship. I think people like seeing people who just drive each other up the wall, but at same time, can't live without each other.
quotes.author: Martin Freeman

quotes.text: As for gun control advocates, I have no hope whatever that any facts whatever will make the slightest dent in their thinking - or lack of thinking.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.text: Humour is the weapon of unarmed people: it helps people who are oppressed to smile at the situation that pains them.
quotes.author: Simon Wiesenthal

quotes.text: Not everything happens for a reason. Sometimes life just sucks.
quotes.author: Alexa Chung

quotes.text: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.
quotes.author: Thomas Mann

quotes.text: There can be nothing exclusive about substantial art. It comes directly out of the heart of the experience of life and thinking about life and living life.
quotes.author: Charles Ives

quotes.text: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.text: You can make anything by writing.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club

quotes.text: You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  I Can Read With My Eyes Shut!

quotes.text: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.text: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.text: One person's craziness is another person's reality.
quotes.author: Tim Burton

quotes.text: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: If there is any one secret of success, it lies in the ability to get the other person's point of view and see things from that person's angle as well as from your own.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: Working with people, the musical part is one thing but the personal part is totally different and just as critical. If the friendship is there and it's a lasting friendship, then it will take care of itself.
quotes.author: John Mayall

quotes.text: A mission is a place where you ask nonbelievers to come and find faith and hope and feel love.
quotes.author: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.text: You will never change your life until you change something you do daily.
quotes.author: Mike Murdock

quotes.text: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.text: Anything you can do to express yourself is a form of art. That's why I love my craft so much. I always wanted to play other artists. If I can't play an instrument, then I want to play a character that can. There is an artist behind everything, and I think that's beautiful.
quotes.author: Emily Rios

quotes.text: I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams,  Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

quotes.text: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
quotes.author: Rose Wilder Lane

quotes.text: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.
quotes.author: Stieg Larsson,  The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

quotes.text: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.

quotes.text: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.text: I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski,  Tales of Ordinary Madness

quotes.text: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.
quotes.author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

quotes.text: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

quotes.text: To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.
quotes.author: Art Spiegelman,  Maus I: A Survivor's Tale: My Father Bleeds History

quotes.text: Shut your eyes and see.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.text: The unfed mind devours itself.

quotes.text: My bounty is as boundless as the sea,My love as deep; the more I give to thee,The more I have, for both are infinite.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

quotes.text: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.

quotes.text: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.

quotes.text: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.

quotes.text: If the United Nations once admits that international disputes can be settled by using force, then we will have destroyed the foundation of the organization and our best hope of establishing a world order.

quotes.text: Humor is mankind's greatest blessing.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable.

quotes.text: Love... it surrounds every being and extends slowly to embrace all that shall be.

quotes.text: Nothing on earth can make up for the loss of one who has loved you.

quotes.text: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.

quotes.text: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.

quotes.text: Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.

quotes.text: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.

quotes.text: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.

quotes.text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

quotes.text: Some walks you have to take alone.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins,  Mockingjay

quotes.text: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.

quotes.text: I must admit that I personally measure success in terms of the contributions an individual makes to her or his fellow human beings.

quotes.text: I'm living by example by continuing on with my career and having a full, rich life, and I am incidentally gay.

quotes.text: And I have exposed myself to art so that my work has something beyond just the usual potter.
quotes.author: Beatrice Wood

quotes.text: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.

quotes.text: As it has been said:Love and a coughcannot be concealed.Even a small cough.Even a small love.

quotes.text: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.

quotes.text: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.

quotes.text: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.

quotes.text: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.

quotes.text: But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.

quotes.text: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up.

quotes.text: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.

quotes.text: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.

quotes.text: The two most important requirements for major success are: first, being in the right place at the right time, and second, doing something about it.

quotes.text: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
quotes.author: Ernie Banks

quotes.text: All the interests of my reason, speculative as well as practical, combine in the three following questions: 1. What can I know? 2. What ought I to do? 3. What may I hope?
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.text: Humor is one of the best ingredients of survival.
quotes.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quotes.text: I only photograph myself at poignant moments in my life as a check of where I am and how large my thighs are.

quotes.text: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.

quotes.text: You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.

quotes.text: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
quotes.author: Rumi,  Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula

quotes.text: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.text: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.

quotes.text: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

quotes.text: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
quotes.author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay

quotes.text: so I wait for you like a lonely housetill you will see me again and live in me.Till then my windows ache.
quotes.author: Pablo Neruda,  100 Love Sonnets

quotes.text: The past is never where you think you left it.

quotes.text: Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!

quotes.text: I have nothing to declare except my genius.

quotes.text: I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.

quotes.text: I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.

quotes.text: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane

quotes.text: The duty of comedy is to correct men by amusing them.

quotes.text: Anime is intended to have ambiguous features. That's part of the art form.

quotes.text: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.

quotes.text: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.

quotes.text: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.

I have a big drafting table set up in a spare bedroom and I cover it with maps and house plans and sketches that I use in the books. Also, I truly love architecture, so that plays a big part in all my books.
quotes.author: Jude Deveraux

quotes.text: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.

quotes.text: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.

quotes.text: Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself.

quotes.text: For those who have made the ultimate sacrifice, we are grateful that such men and women were among us. For those who continue to serve, we honor their commitment. For those who return to civilian life, we honor their service.

quotes.text: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.

quotes.text: The educator must believe in the potential power of his pupil, and he must employ all his art in seeking to bring his pupil to experience this power.
quotes.author: Alfred Adler

quotes.text: Little by little, one travels far

quotes.text: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby

quotes.text: I restore myself when I'm alone.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: I just want to be wonderful.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quotes.text: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
quotes.author: Julie Kagawa,  The Iron King

quotes.text: I got schooled this yearbyaboy.A boy that I'm seriously, deeply, madly, incredibly, and undeniably in  love  with.And he taught me the most important thing of all...To put the emphasisOn  life .
quotes.author: Colleen Hoover,  Slammed

quotes.text: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.
quotes.author: Jane Austen,  Love and Friendship

quotes.text: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.text: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.text: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
quotes.author: Louis L'Amour,  Matagorda/The First Fast Draw

quotes.text: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
quotes.author: George Orwell,  1984

quotes.text: One must dare to be happy.

quotes.text: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven

quotes.text: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
quotes.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

quotes.text: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
quotes.author: Arundhati Roy,  The God of Small Things

quotes.text: Success represents the 1% of your work which results from the 99% that is called failure.
quotes.author: Soichiro Honda

quotes.text: One friend in a lifetime is much, two are many, three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.text: The care of the Earth is our most ancient and most worthy, and after all our most pleasing responsibility. To cherish what remains of it and to foster its renewal is our only hope.
quotes.author: Wendell Berry

quotes.text: Good planning is important. I've also regarded a sense of humor as one of the most important things on a big expedition. When you're in a difficult or dangerous situation, or when you're depressed about the chances of success, someone who can make you laugh eases the tension.
quotes.author: Edmund Hillary

quotes.text: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
quotes.author: Morris West

quotes.text: Love is suffering. One side always loves more.
quotes.author: Catherine Deneuve

quotes.text: My philosophy is that I'm an artist. I perform an art not with a paint brush or a camera. I perform with bodily movement. Instead of exhibiting my art in a museum or a book or on canvas, I exhibit my art in front of the multitudes.

quotes.text: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables

quotes.text: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.text: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

quotes.text: To err is human, to forgive, divine.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope,  An Essay on Criticism

quotes.text: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley,  Brave New World

quotes.text: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.
quotes.author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner

quotes.text: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,  The Scarlet Letter

quotes.text: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
quotes.author: Suzanne Collins,  The Hunger Games

quotes.text: Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.
quotes.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quotes.text: Luxury is the wolf at the door and its fangs are the vanities and conceits germinated by success. When an artist learns this, he knows where the danger is.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.text: My goal is to be the best quarterback I can be for the Colts, and hope that it's good enough.

quotes.text: If you can get humor and seriousness at the same time, you've created a special little thing, and that's what I'm looking for, because if you get pompous, you lose everything.

quotes.text: Don't threaten me with love, baby. Let's just go walking in the rain.
quotes.author: Billie Holiday

quotes.text: Art is much less important than life, but what a poor life without it.
quotes.author: Robert Motherwell

quotes.text: ...you can hate a place with all your heart and soul and still be homesick for it.
quotes.author: Joseph Mitchell

quotes.text: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
quotes.author: David Nicholls,  One Day

quotes.text: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know.
quotes.author: Sarah Vowell,  The Partly Cloudy Patriot

quotes.text: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.

quotes.author: Thomas Paine,  A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America

quotes.text: I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.

quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

quotes.text: Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish.

quotes.text: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.

quotes.author: Maria Bartiromo

If you have a partner who you believe is a good person, then it is your duty to have faith in them until the end, despite the fact that they might have done some bad things. And you have to support and believe in your children.
quotes.author: Greg Graffin

quotes.text: Many possessions, if they do not make a man better, are at least expected to make his children happier; and this pathetic hope is behind many exertions.

quotes.text: You make a choice in your life, and it affects your life in all the ways, good and bad.

quotes.text: More than kisses, letters mingle souls.

quotes.text: She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.
quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor

quotes.text: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!
quotes.author: C.J. Cherryh

quotes.text: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.

quotes.text: I like good strong words that mean something…

quotes.text: We are always the same age inside.

quotes.text: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.

quotes.text: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.
