quotes.text: I can only hope the federal aid made available today will be sufficient in our recovery efforts, and pray that our citizens continue to be safe from the fallout of this dangerous natural disaster.
quotes.author: Mike Rogers

quotes.text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I've been encouraging documentary filmmakers to use more and more humor, and they're loath to do that because they think if it's a documentary it has to be deadly serious - it has to be like medicine that you're supposed to take. And I think it's what keeps the mass audience from going to documentaries.
quotes.author: Michael Moore

quotes.text: The concept of commercialism in the fashion and art world is looked down upon. You know, just to think, 'What amount of creativity does it take to make something that masses of people like?' And, 'How does creativity apply across the board?'
quotes.author: Kanye West

quotes.text: Those who are not looking for happiness are the most likely to find it, because those who are searching forget that the surest way to be happy is to seek happiness for others.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: To say that one waits a lifetime for his soulmate to come around is a paradox. People eventually get sick of waiting, take a chance on someone, and by the art of commitment become soulmates, which takes a lifetime to perfect.
quotes.author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms

quotes.text: There's so much to be grateful for, words are poor things.
quotes.author: Marilynne Robinson,  Home

quotes.text: Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: I love new clothes. If everyone could just wear new clothes everyday, I reckon depression wouldn’t exist anymore.
quotes.author: Sophie Kinsella,  Confessions of a Shopaholic

quotes.text: Success is most often achieved by those who don't know that failure is inevitable.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel,  Believing in Ourselves: The Wisdom of Women

quotes.text: Do I love you? My God, if your love were a grain of sand, mine would be a universe of beaches.
quotes.author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quotes.text: Unless you love someone, nothing else makes sense.
quotes.author: E.E. Cummings

quotes.text: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray

quotes.text: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
quotes.author: Earl Nightingale

quotes.text: Success is getting and achieving what you want. Happiness is wanting and being content with what you get.
quotes.author: Bernard Meltzer

quotes.text: Laughter is not a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is the best ending for one.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: I love the big fresh starts, the clean slates like birthdays and new years, but I also really like the idea that we can get up every morning and start over.
quotes.author: Kristin Armstrong

quotes.text: And God help Bruce Springsteen when they decide he's no longer God... They'll turn on him, and I hope he survives it.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: I don't think of myself as funny - I don't fill up a room with my humor... I would fail miserably as a stand-up comedian.
quotes.author: Steve Carell

quotes.text: I love having my hands in the dirt. It is never a science and always an art. There are no rules. And if it comes down to me versus that weed I'm trying to pull out of the ground that doesn't want to come out? I know I'll win.
quotes.author: Matthew McConaughey

quotes.text: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard,  The Roycroft Dictionary Concocted by Ali Baba and the Bunch on Rainy Days

quotes.text: If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them.
quotes.author: Christopher Moore,  Practical Demonkeeping

quotes.text: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives - choice, not chance, determines your destiny.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: It is an ironic habit of human beings to run faster when they have lost their way.
quotes.author: Rollo May

quotes.text: You're like a song that I heard when I was a little kid but forgot I knew until I heard it again.
quotes.author: Maggie Stiefvater,  Lament: The Faerie Queen's Deception

quotes.text: Well, that's your opinion, isn't it? And I'm not about to waste my time trying to change it.
quotes.author: Lady Gaga

quotes.text: I hated sports. I hated sports, and I hated people who played them, and I hated people who watched them, and I hated people who didn't hate people who watched or played them.
quotes.author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

quotes.text: Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

quotes.text: I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: Perhaps the truth depends on a walk around the lake.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.text: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
quotes.author: Phillips Brooks

quotes.text: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage 'coaches' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
quotes.author: Herbert Kaufman

quotes.text: Caring for but never trying to own may be a further way to define friendship.
quotes.author: William Glasser

quotes.text: I'm so single. It's funny. I'm usually a relationship girl. I love being in love and having a partner in crime. But it's good to be your own partner in crime. God, that makes me sound like I have multiple-personality disorder.
quotes.author: Brittany Snow

quotes.text: One thing I hope I'll never be is drunk with my own power. And anybody who says I am will never work in this town again.
quotes.author: Jim Carrey

quotes.text: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
quotes.author: Sholom Aleichem

quotes.text: Among my friends, I'm not a little Boy Scout, and they love my humor, thank God.
quotes.author: Don Rickles

quotes.text: Technology is a compulsive and addictive way to live. Verbal communication cannot be lost because of a lack of skill. The ability to listen and learn is key to mastering the art of communication. If you don't use your verbal skills and networking, it will disappear rapidly. Use technology wisely.
quotes.author: Rick Pitino

quotes.text: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quotes.text: The only thing more unthinkable than leaving was staying; the only thing more impossible than staying was leaving.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: 1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: My mother... she is beautiful, softened at the edges and tempered with a spine of steel. I want to grow old and be like her.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.text: A dame that knows the ropes isn't likely to get tied up.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.text: If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: I can tell if two people are in love by how they hold each other’s hands, and how thick their sanitation gloves are.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quotes.text: I am fated to journey hand in hand with my strange heroes and to survey the surging immensity of life, to survey it through the laughter that all can see and through the tears unseen and unknown by anyone.
quotes.author: Nikolai Gogol

quotes.text: For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King

quotes.text: I know why I am here and my only real focused goal is to live each day to the fullest and to try and honor God and be an encouragement to others. What the future holds is firmly in God's hands, and I am very happy about that!
quotes.author: Ken Hensley

quotes.text: No foreign policy - no matter how ingenious - has any chance of success if it is born in the minds of a few and carried in the hearts of none.
quotes.author: Henry A. Kissinger

quotes.text: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker.
quotes.author: Jean de la Bruyere

quotes.text: America is an empire. I hope you know that now. All empires, by definition, are bumbling, shambolic, bullying, bureaucratic affairs, as certain of the rightness of their cause in infancy, as they are corrupted by power in their dotage.
quotes.author: Felix Dennis

quotes.text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: I personally have dealt with any adversity in my life with humor. That's why I told America to 'Read my hips!' on 'Dancing With the Stars' or was happy to play along with Jason Alexander and Jerry Seinfeld in the great restaurant scene on 'Seinfeld.'
quotes.author: Marlee Matlin

quotes.text: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.text: The scariest thing about distance is that you don’t know whether they’ll miss you or forget you.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

quotes.text: So many people enter and leave your life! Hundreds of thousands of people! You have to keep the door open so they can come in! But it also means you have to let them go!
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quotes.text: If I were to live a thousand years, I would belong to you for all of them. If we were to live a thousand lives, I would want to make you mine in each one.
quotes.author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer

quotes.text: Write what should not be forgotten.
quotes.author: Isabel Allende

quotes.text: It's not all bad. Heightened self-consciousness, apartness, an inability to join in, physical shame and self-loathing—they are not all bad. Those devils have been my angels. Without them I would never have disappeared into language, literature, the mind, laughter and all the mad intensities that made and unmade me.
quotes.author: Stephen Fry,  Moab Is My Washpot

quotes.text: to live in this worldyou must be ableto do three thingsto love what is mortal;to hold itagainst your bones knowingyour own life depends on it;and, when the time comes to let it go,to let it go
quotes.author: Mary Oliver,  New and Selected Poems, Vol. 1

quotes.text: Once, poets were magicians. Poets were strong, stronger than warriors or kings — stronger than old hapless gods. And they will be strong once again.
quotes.author: Greg Bear

quotes.text: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
quotes.author: Michael Levine

quotes.text: Here lies Dobby, a free elf.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: Heaven would never be heaven without you.
quotes.author: Richard Matheson,  What Dreams May Come

quotes.text: We meet no ordinary people in our lives.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: Snape's patronus was a doe,' said Harry, 'the same as my mother's because he loved her for nearly all of his life, from when they were children.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: God is silent. Now if only man would shut up.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: It’s dark now and I am very tired. I love you, always. Time is nothing.
quotes.author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

quotes.text: Yours is the light by which my spirit's born: - you are my sun, my moon, and all my stars.
quotes.author: E.E. Cummings

quotes.text: Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina

quotes.text: Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: In the United States there's a Puritan ethic and a mythology of success. He who is successful is good. In Latin countries, in Catholic countries, a successful person is a sinner.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: As soon as you try to describe a close friendship, it loses something.
quotes.author: Dean Smith

quotes.text: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
quotes.author: Theodore Hesburgh

quotes.text: We are all here to be a service to those who can't be a service to themselves. We can give people hope and more reasons for being human.
quotes.author: Dionne Warwick

quotes.text: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
quotes.author: Eminem

quotes.text: If I ever have sex with someone I might be able to develop a sense of humor.
quotes.author: Kate Beckinsale

quotes.text: We at BMW do not build cars as consumer objects, just to drive from A to B. We build mobile works of art.
quotes.author: Chris Bangle

quotes.text: In wine there is wisdom, in beer there is Freedom, in water there is bacteria.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and gets to bed at night, and in between he does what he wants to do.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.text: Around here, however, we don't look backwards for very long. We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we're curious...and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.

quotes.text: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long.Good things come to those who wait.
quotes.author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern

quotes.text: My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.
quotes.author: Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.text: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck,  Travels with Charley: In Search of America

quotes.text: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: I know every book of mine by its smell, and I have but to put my nose between the pages to be reminded of all sorts of things.
quotes.author: George Gissing

quotes.text: Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake.
quotes.author: Jon Stewart

quotes.text: Books make great gifts because they have whole worlds inside of them. And it's much cheaper to buy somebody a book than it is to buy them the whole world!
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.text: Make the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: It isn't as bad as you sometimes think it is. It all works out. Don't worry. I say that to myself every morning. It all works out in the end. Put your trust in God, and move forward with faith and confidence in the future. The Lord will not forsake us. He will not forsake us. If we will put our trust in Him, if we will pray to Him, if we will live worthy of His blessings, He will hear our prayers.
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.text: It's so curious: one can resist tears and 'behave' very well in the hardest hours of grief. But then someone makes you a friendly sign behind a window, or one notices that a flower that was in bud only yesterday has suddenly blossomed, or a letter slips from a drawer... and everything collapses.
quotes.author: Colette

quotes.text: What we need is more people who specialize in the impossible.
quotes.author: Theodore Roethke

quotes.text: The only way to permanently change the temperature in the room is to reset the thermostat. In the same way, the only way to change your level of financial success 'permanently' is to reset your financial thermostat. But it is your choice whether you choose to change.
quotes.author: T. Harv Eker

quotes.text: Friendship is mutual blackmail elevated to the level of love.
quotes.author: Robin Morgan

quotes.text: If you live long enough, you'll make mistakes. But if you learn from them, you'll be a better person. It's how you handle adversity, not how it affects you. The main thing is never quit, never quit, never quit.
quotes.author: William J. Clinton

quotes.text: I quite like dark humor.
quotes.author: Marina and the Diamonds

quotes.text: Art imitates life and, sometimes, life imitates art. It's a weird combination of elements.
quotes.author: Bruce Willis

quotes.text: I think we ought to live happily ever after.
quotes.author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Howl's Moving Castle

quotes.text: He liked the mere act of reading, the magic of turning scratches on a page into words inside his head.
quotes.author: John Green,  An Abundance of Katherines

quotes.text: Because, if you could love someone, and keep loving them, without being loved back . . . then that love had to be real. It hurt too much to be anything else.

quotes.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: Just be yourself, there is no one better.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: You're so full of crap, you could pass for a toilet.
quotes.author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Creatures

quotes.text: She looked like the kind of woman I could fall in love with. Trouble is, she was standing next to the kind of woman I’d like to make love to.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title

quotes.text: She's the sort of woman who lives for others - you can tell the others by their hunted expression.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis,  The Screwtape Letters

quotes.text: If only there could be an invention that bottled up a memory, like scent. And it never faded, and it never got stale. And then, when one wanted it, the bottle could be uncorked, and it would be like living the moment all over again.

quotes.text: I'm saying I'm in love with you! I've been in love with you this whole bleeding year!
quotes.author: Stephanie Perkins,  Anna and the French Kiss

quotes.text: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Whenever an individual or a business decides that success has been attained, progress stops.
quotes.author: Thomas J. Watson

quotes.text: Success always necessitates a degree of ruthlessness. Given the choice of friendship or success, I'd probably choose success.
quotes.author: Sting

quotes.text: To all the other dreamers out there, don't ever stop or let the world's negativity disenchant you or your spirit. If you surround yourself with love and the right people, anything is possible.

quotes.text: The murder of Lumumba, in which the U.S. was involved, in the Congo destroyed Africa's major hope for development. Congo is now total horror story, for years.

quotes.text: I'm not just a big-haired redhead country singer who dresses flamboyantly, has this wicked sense of humor and wears rhinestones.
quotes.author: Naomi Judd

quotes.text: My art is an attempt to reach beyond the surface appearance. I want to see growth in wood, time in stone, nature in a city, and I do not mean its parks but a deeper understanding that a city is nature too-the ground upon which it is built, the stone with which it is made.
quotes.author: Andy Goldsworthy

quotes.text: He is beauty, inside and out.He is the silver lining in a world of darkness.He is my light.
quotes.author: Marie Lu,  Prodigy

quotes.text: Despite your best efforts, people are going to be hurt when it's time for them to be hurt.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood

quotes.text: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin,  The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 7: 1966-1974

quotes.text: Books are always obviously having conversations with other books, and some times they're amiable and sometimes not.
quotes.author: China Miéville,  The City & the City

quotes.text: You know what I like most about people? Pets.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  Who Moved My Choose?: An Amazing Way to Deal With Change by Deciding to Let Indecision Into Your Life

quotes.text: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, It's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope. Which is what I do, And that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance
quotes.author: E.E. Cummings

quotes.text: I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions.
quotes.author: James A. Michener

quotes.text: Life is worth living as long as there's a laugh in it.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables

quotes.text: All the effort in the world won't matter if you're not inspired.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary

quotes.text: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
quotes.author: Sylvester Stallone

quotes.text: Enjoy your sweat because hard work doesn't guarantee success, but without it you don't have a chance.
quotes.author: Alex Rodriguez

quotes.text: I have lost my seven best friends, which is to say God has had mercy on me seven times without realizing it. He lent a friendship, took it from me, sent me another.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: Conservatism is not about leaving people behind. Conservatism is about empowering people to catch up, to give them the tools at their disposable that make it possible for them to access all the hope, all the promise, all the opportunity that America offers. And our programs to help them should reflect that.

quotes.text: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: I tried to go out for theater or theater arts, but I was too scared or too intimidated. But I had a lot of friends on the cross country team that had great senses of humor.

quotes.text: The show business has all phases and grades of dignity, from the exhibition of a monkey to the exposition of that highest art in music or the drama which secures for the gifted artists a world-wide fame princes well might envy.
quotes.author: P. T. Barnum

quotes.text: Every luxury must be paid for, and everything is a luxury, starting with being in this world.
quotes.author: Cesare Pavese,  Il mestiere di vivere: Diario 1935-1950

quotes.text: Dying is an art.Like everything else,I do it exceptionally well.I do it so it feels like hell.I do it so it feels real.I guess you could say I have a call.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath,  Ariel

quotes.text: I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage.
quotes.author: Roald Dahl

quotes.text: What greater gift than the love of a cat.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: I mean, you could claim that anything's real if the only basis for believing in it is that nobody's proved it doesn't exist!

quotes.text: listen: there’s a hellof a good universe next door; let’s go
quotes.author: E.E. Cummings

quotes.text: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.

quotes.text: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.

quotes.text: The best things in life make you sweaty.

quotes.text: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.
quotes.author: Henry Rollins

quotes.text: Music melts all the separate parts of our bodies together.
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

quotes.text: Our wounds are often the openings into the best and most beautiful part of us.

quotes.text: Lord, grant that I may always desire more than I can accomplish.

quotes.text: The ideal friendship is to feel as one while remaining two.

quotes.text: When we are in love we often doubt that which we most believe.

quotes.text: When I consider life, it is all a cheat. Yet fooled with hope, people favor this deceit.

quotes.text: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.

quotes.text: I used to be neurotic. I didn't like myself very much. But somewhere in my mid-40s, my neuroses stopped seeming so important. I developed a sense of humor.

quotes.text: Life itself is offensive and certainly does not apologize - in fact, it hurts considerably and, as we all know, is often very rude and troublesome, just as nature or art can be.

quotes.text: I'm not sure this is a world I belong in anymore. I'm not sure that I want to wake up.

quotes.text: I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously revived, great and strong! He made me love him without looking at me.

quotes.text: Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.

quotes.text: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.

quotes.text: I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead.

quotes.text: People, I thought, wanted security. They couldn't bear the idea of death being a big black nothing, couldn't bear the thought of their loved ones not existing, and couldn't even imagine themselves not existing. I finally decided that people believed in an afterlife because they couldn't bear not to.

quotes.text: There are two ways to reach me: by way of kisses or by way of the imagination. But there is a hierarchy: the kisses alone don't work.

quotes.text: The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.

quotes.text: I don’t know what they are called, the spaces between seconds– but I think of you always in those intervals.

quotes.text: Give light and people will find the way.

quotes.text: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.

quotes.text: Friendship is something that creates equality and mutuality, not a reward for finding equality or a way of intensifying existing mutuality.

quotes.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.

quotes.text: Robert Walker as Bruno was excellent. He had elegance and humor, and the proper fondness for his mother.

quotes.text: When you make art, you get really invested in it. When art happens by accident and you were just along for the ride? It's way more fun.

quotes.text: Fiction is art and art is the triumph over chaos… to celebrate a world that lies spread out around us like a bewildering and stupendous dream.

quotes.text: In politics, stupidity is not a handicap.

quotes.author: Francis Bacon,  The Essays

quotes.text: Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish.

quotes.text: If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose.
quotes.author: Gene Stratton-Porter,  A Girl of the Limberlost

quotes.text: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
quotes.author: Jessamyn West

quotes.text: Doctor Who: You want weapons? We're in a library. Books are the best weapon in the world. This room's the greatest arsenal we could have. Arm yourself!(from Tooth and Claw in Season 2)
quotes.author: Russell T. Davies

quotes.text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke,  Profiles of the Future: An Inquiry Into the Limits of the Possible

quotes.text: Oh, Life, I am yours. Whatever it is you want of me, I am ready to give.
quotes.author: William Steig,  Dominic

quotes.text: Women cannot complain about men anymore until they start getting better taste in them.

quotes.text: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
quotes.author: Johannes Brahms

quotes.text: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.

quotes.text: I have a very close friendship with the skaters.

quotes.text: The Vietnamese people deeply love independence, freedom and peace. But in the face of United States aggression they have risen up, united as one man.
quotes.author: Ho Chi Minh

quotes.text: My life is my message.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: I reread Mesrine's book every year because the way the story is told is fascinating. Today, we don't have gangsters like Mesrine - he had humor.
quotes.author: Thomas Langmann

quotes.text: I was born in the '60s and grew up in the '70s - not exactly the best decade for food in British history. It was horrendous. It was a time when, as a nation, we excelled in art and music and acting and photography and fashion - all creative skills... all apart from cooking.
quotes.author: Heston Blumenthal

quotes.text: There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.

quotes.text: I have never found anybody who could stand to accept the daily demonstrative love I feel in me, and give back as good as I give.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath,  The Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Okay, God, I thought. Get me out of this and I’ll stop my half-assed church-going ways. You got me past a pack of Strigoi tonight. I mean, trapping that one between the doors really shouldn't have worked, so clearly you're on board. Let me get out of here, and I’ll...I don’t know. Donate Adrian’s money to the poor. Get baptized. Join a convent. Well, no. Not that last one.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Blood Promise

quotes.text: Hooray! Hooray! The end of the world has been postponed!
quotes.author: Hergé,  The Shooting Star

quotes.text: People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
quotes.author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

quotes.text: Parents were the only ones obligated to love you; from the rest of the world you had to earn it.
quotes.author: Ann Brashares,  Forever in Blue: The Fourth Summer of the Sisterhood

quotes.text: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.
quotes.author: William Ellery Channing

quotes.text: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
quotes.author: Babe Ruth

quotes.text: I would like to raise my glass to friendship between Russia and the United States.
quotes.author: Richard Lugar

quotes.text: I grew up at my grandmother's house, and she had a beautiful garden. I used to hate mowing the lawn and weeding, which is what you do when you're a kid. I loathe gardening, but I love gardens, and I have two beautiful gardens.
quotes.author: Elton John

quotes.text: Everything has been figured out, except how to live.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: I think that different pleasures work for different readers - a friend of mine won't read anything that's not a cardiovascular sort of page-turner. I tend to care less about plot, but I'm a sucker for humor and strangeness.
quotes.author: Karen Russell

quotes.text: Art reflects society. Cinema doesn't dictate - you portray what the society demands.
quotes.author: Sonam Kapoor

quotes.text: Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.text: People have to forgive. We don't have to like them, we don't have to be friends with them, we don't have to send them hearts in text messages, but we have to forgive them, to overlook, to forget. Because if we don't we are tying rocks to our feet, too much for our wings to carry!
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: Happily ever after, or even just together ever after, is not cheesy,” Wren said. “It’s the noblest, like, the most courageous thing two people can shoot for.
quotes.author: Rainbow Rowell,  Fangirl

quotes.text: You can’t put a price tag on love. But if you could, I’d wait for it to go on sale.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quotes.text: Expect everything, I always say, and the unexpected never happens.
quotes.author: Norton Juster,  The Phantom Tollbooth

quotes.text: Books don't offer real escape, but they can stop a mind scratching itself raw.
quotes.author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

quotes.text: I'm sorry for my inability to let unimportant things go, for my inability to hold on to the important things.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.text: Look for God, suggests my Guru. Look for God like a man with his head on fire looks for water.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.text: I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.
quotes.author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,  Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

quotes.text: When in a relationship, a real man doesn't make his woman jealous of others, he makes others jealous of his woman.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quotes.text: It's funny how you can forget everything except people loving you. Maybe that's why humans find it so hard getting over love affairs. It's not the pain they're getting over, it's the love.
quotes.author: Melina Marchetta,  On the Jellicoe Road

quotes.text: I don’t live in either my past or my future. I’m interested only in the present. If you can concentrate always on the present, you’ll be a happy man. Life will be a party for you, a grand festival, because life is the moment we’re living now.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quotes.text: Curiouser and curiouser.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking-Glass

quotes.text: It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates.
quotes.author: Nisargadatta Maharaj

quotes.text: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts. There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature -- the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter.
quotes.author: Rachel Carson,  Silent Spring

quotes.text: Today a young man on acid realized that all matter is merely energy condensed to a slow vibration, that we are all one consciousness experiencing itself subjectively, there is no such thing as death, life is only a dream, and we are the imagination of ourselves. Heres Tom with the Weather.
quotes.author: Bill Hicks

quotes.text: I know my heart will never be the sameBut I'm telling myself I'll be okay
quotes.author: Sara Evans

quotes.text: I do not miss childhood, but I miss the way I took pleasure in small things, even as greater things crumbled. I could not control the world I was in, could not walk away from things or people or moments that hurt, but I took joy in the things that made me happy.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

quotes.text: I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State. ... These two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.text: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already 3-parts dead.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.text: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.text: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.text: Sweet is the scene where genial friendship plays the pleasing game of interchanging praise.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.text: The greatest movement for social justice our country has ever known is the civil rights movement and it was totally rooted in a love ethic.
quotes.author: bell hooks

quotes.text: I get nostalgic for British negativity. There is an inherent hope and positive drive to New Yorkers. When you go back to Britain, everybody is just running everything down. It's like whatever the opposite of a hug is.
quotes.author: John Oliver

quotes.text: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.
quotes.author: William Morris

quotes.text: I have been definitely influenced more by Latin American writers than by any other type of writer. They are very close in terms of voice - their humor, their fatalism, their... well, that over-used term 'magical realism.' It's a wonderful term that's just been used so much, we don't know what it means anymore.
quotes.author: Jessica Hagedorn

quotes.text: If I didn't choose art, I would have become an astronomer.
quotes.author: Peter Max

quotes.text: With him, life was routine; without him, life was unbearable.
quotes.author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird

quotes.text: Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: The day the power of love overrules the love of power, the world will know peace.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: What we wait around a lifetime for with one person, we can find in a moment with someone else.
quotes.author: Stephanie Klein,  Straight Up and Dirty

quotes.text: Every one of us is losing something precious to us. Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back again. That’s part of what it means to be alive.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

quotes.text: Dream as if you will live forever; Live as if you will die today.
quotes.author: James Dean

quotes.text: My heart is warm with the friends I make,And better friends I'll not be knowing,Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take,No matter where it's going.
quotes.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  The Selected Poetry

quotes.text: Life is too short, or too long, for me to allow myself the luxury of living it so badly.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything.
quotes.author: Laurence Sterne

quotes.text: I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.text: You forget, darling.I am the local psychopath.
quotes.author: Kelley Armstrong,  Bitten

quotes.text: The first duty of a man is to think for himself
quotes.author: José Martí

quotes.text: The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: It's better to burn out than to fade away.
quotes.author: Neil Young

quotes.text: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw,  Immaturity

quotes.text: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Art of Happiness

quotes.text: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.
quotes.author: e. e. cummings

quotes.text: I take friendship very seriously.
quotes.author: Wole Soyinka

quotes.text: Rwanda can be a paradise again, but it will take the love of the entire world to heal my homeland. And that's as it should be, for what happened in Rwanda happened to us all - humanity was wounded by the genocide.
quotes.author: Immaculee Ilibagiza

quotes.text: The United Nations is our one great hope for a peaceful and free world.
quotes.author: Ralph Bunche

quotes.text: I grew up as a very sarcastic person. I was always the class clown, and to date girls, I had to be really funny. I was really skinny growing up. I was so thin, I had to run around in the shower to get wet. That kind of thin. So I always had to rely on humor and sarcasm.
quotes.author: Kurt Fuller

quotes.text: London, thou art the flower of cities all!
quotes.author: William Dunbar

quotes.text: Without fear there cannot be courage.
quotes.author: Christopher Paolini

quotes.text: There's a difference between really loving someone and loving the idea of her.
quotes.author: Gillian Flynn,  Gone Girl

quotes.text: The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.text: Fairy tales do not tell children the dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist. Fairy tales tell children the dragons can be killed.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Find out the reason that commands you to write; see whether it has spread its roots into the very depth of your heart; confess to yourself you would have to die if you were forbidden to write.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quotes.text: How much I missed, simply because I was afraid of missing it.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida

quotes.text: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Those are my principles, and if you don't like them...well I have others.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose.
quotes.author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain

quotes.text: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.text: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
quotes.author: Morihei Ueshiba

quotes.text: I didn't like England. I couldn't take the look of the place or the style of friendship. I need more intimacy from people than is considered okay there, and I felt that my personality and my enthusiasms weren't understood. I had to put a big lid on myself.
quotes.author: Jane Campion

quotes.text: Women are tenacious, and all of them should be tenacious of respect; without esteem they cannot exist; esteem is the first demand that they make of love.
quotes.author: Honore de Balzac

quotes.text: The less we deserve good fortune, the more we hope for it.
quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.text: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.
quotes.author: Rose Kennedy

quotes.text: Set your compass to beauty, humor, and grief; stay the course no matter what, and I'll support you with everything I've got.
quotes.author: Chris Jordan

quotes.text: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper.
quotes.author: Michael Cunningham

quotes.text: My life is a perfect graveyard of buried hopes.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables

quotes.text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Who says life is fair, where is that written?
quotes.author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quotes.text: All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed; Second, it is violently opposed; Third, it is accepted as self-evident.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.text: It is the very mark of the spirit of rebellion to crave for happiness in this life
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen,  Ghosts

quotes.text: We always see our worst selves. Our most vulnerable selves. We need someone else to get close enough to tell us we’re wrong. Someone we trust.
quotes.author: David Levithan,  Naomi and Ely's No Kiss List

quotes.text: This is not a goodbye, my darling, this is a thank you. Thank you for coming into my life and giving me joy, thank you for loving me and receiving my love in return. Thank you for the memories I will cherish forever. But most of all, thank you for showing me that there will come a time when I can eventually let you go.I love you, T.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  Message in a Bottle

quotes.text: It's okay,” he said. “We're together.” He didn't say you're okay, or we're alive. After all they'd been through over the last year, he knew that the most important thing was that they were together. She loved him for saying that.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena

quotes.text: No one loses anyone, because no one owns anyone. That is the true experience of freedom: having the most important thing in the world without owning it
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes

quotes.text: One can't fight with oneself, for this battle has only one loser.
quotes.author: Mario Vargas Llosa,  Aunt Julia and the Scriptwriter

quotes.text: I do this real moron thing, and it's called thinking. And apparently I'm not a very good American because I like to form my own opinions.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.text: It’s absolutely unfair for women to say that guys only want one thing: sex. We also want food.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  $3.33

quotes.text: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
quotes.author: Lucy Larcom

quotes.text: Sometimes we may ask God for success, and He gives us physical and mental stamina. We might plead for prosperity, and we receive enlarged perspective and increased patience, or we petition for growth and are blessed with the gift of grace. He may bestow upon us conviction and confidence as we strive to achieve worthy goals.
quotes.author: David A. Bednar

quotes.text: China-Africa relationship has a long history and is full of vitality. Since the 1950s and 1960s, our common historical experiences have brought China and Africa together, and we have forged deep friendship in our joint struggle during which we have supported each other in times of difficulty.
quotes.author: Li Keqiang

quotes.text: It is here, my daughters, that love is to be found - not hidden away in corners but in the midst of occasions of sin. And believe me, although we may more often fail and commit small lapses, our gain will be incomparably the greater.
quotes.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: I never really thought of myself as depressed so much as paralyzed by hope.
quotes.author: Maria Bamford

quotes.text: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: I guess, for me, I've always thought that there was humor everywhere. And as a kid, I just, you know, I grew up an only child, and I - sort of nothing made me happier than to make my parents laugh. I remember I had costumes and things laying around the house that I was, you know, anything that I could do to make my parents laugh.
quotes.author: Justin Timberlake

quotes.text: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: have i gone mad?im afraid so, but let me tell you something, the best people usualy are.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll,  Alice in Wonderland

quotes.text: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: I used to advertise my loyalty and I don't believe there is a single person I loved that I didn't eventually betray.
quotes.author: Albert Camus,  The Fall

quotes.text: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance, and gloom is but the passing shadow of a cloud...
quotes.author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quotes.text: It all goes away. Eventually, everything goes away.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: There is the great lesson of 'Beauty and the Beast,' that a thing must be loved before it is lovable.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: I’m just sick of ego, ego, ego. My own and everybody else’s. I’m sick of everybody that wants to get somewhere, do something distinguished and all, be somebody interesting. It’s disgusting.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey

quotes.text: As far as I'm concerned, if something is so complicated that you can't explain it in 10 seconds, then it's probably not worth knowing anyway.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson,  The Indispensable Calvin and Hobbes

quotes.text: Ideas shape the course of history.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.text: God has already done everything He's going to do. The ball is now in your court. If you want success, if you want wisdom, if you want to be prosperous and healthy, you're going to have to do more than meditate and believe; you must boldly declare words of faith and victory over yourself and your family.
quotes.author: Joel Osteen

quotes.text: It will give them the opportunity to show themselves worthy of the respect and friendship of peace-loving nations, and in time, to take an honorable place among members of the United Nations.
quotes.author: James F. Byrnes

quotes.text: It is not sacrifice if you love what you're doing.
quotes.author: Mia Hamm

quotes.text: Whenever you have an ex, and they're like, 'I hope we can still be friends!' and you weren't friends before you started dating, then what do you go back to, really?
quotes.author: Ed Sheeran

quotes.text: I never worry about people not taking my work seriously as a result of the humor. In the end, the comic's best trick is the illusion that comedy is effortless. That people imagine what he's doing is easy is an occupational hazard.
quotes.author: Richard Russo

quotes.text: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.text: Of course I’ll hurt you. Of course you’ll hurt me. Of course we will hurt each other. But this is the very condition of existence. To become spring, means accepting the risk of winter. To become presence, means accepting the risk of absence.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  Manon, Ballerina

quotes.text: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are.
quotes.author: José Saramago,  Blindness

quotes.text: I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.text: You wanted hearts and flowers,” he murmurs.I blink at him, not quite believing what I’m seeing.“You have my heart.” And he waves toward the room.“And here are the flowers,” I whisper, completing his sentence. “Christian, it’s lovely.
quotes.author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades Darker

quotes.text: Damn me to hell or take me to heaven, but for Gods sake, do it now....
quotes.author: Nora Roberts,  The Stanislaski Brothers: Mikhail and Alex

quotes.text: Why can't people just sit and read books and be nice to each other?
quotes.author: David Baldacci,  The Camel Club

quotes.text: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: My body is my journal, and my tattoos are my story.
quotes.author: Johnny Depp

quotes.text: It's a moment that I'm after, a fleeting moment, but not a frozen moment.
quotes.author: Andrew Wyeth

quotes.text: We learned about honesty and integrity - that the truth matters... that you don't take shortcuts or play by your own set of rules... and success doesn't count unless you earn it fair and square.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.text: I love 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' and 'Extras' and also 'The Trip.' That had all the nuances of friendship and finding things out about their lives without it being too much plot-driven.
quotes.author: Dolly Wells

quotes.text: Hope cannot be said to exist, nor can it be said not to exist. It is just like roads across the earth. For actually the earth had no roads to begin with, but when many men pass one way, a road is made.
quotes.author: Lu Xun

quotes.text: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
quotes.author: William Feather

quotes.text: The man with the real sense of humor is the man who can put himself in the spectator's place and laugh at his own misfortune.
quotes.author: Bert Williams

quotes.text: All architecture is great architecture after sunset; perhaps architecture is really a nocturnal art, like the art of fireworks.
quotes.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Also, I'm sleeping with your mom. Just thought you should know.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

quotes.text: Only bad books have good endings.If a book is any good, it's ending is always bad - because you don't want the book to end.
quotes.author: Pseudonymous Bosch,  The Name of This Book Is Secret

quotes.text: MS. THOMPSON, it said in heavy block letters, PLEASE KEEP YOUR FELINE OFF MY PROPERTY. IF I SEE IT AGAIN, I WILL EAT IT.
quotes.author: Patricia Briggs,  Moon Called

quotes.text: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde,  The Soul of Man Under Socialism, and Selected Critical Prose

quotes.text: Separation Your absence has gone through me Like thread through a needle. Everything I do is stitched with its color.
quotes.author: W.S. Merwin

quotes.text: Be empty of worrying.Think of who created thought!Why do you stay in prisonWhen the door is so wide open?
quotes.author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi

quotes.text: Literature is news that stays news.
quotes.author: Ezra Pound,  ABC of Reading

quotes.text: I know that the whole point—the only point—is tofind the things that matter, and hold on to them, and fight for them, and refuse tolet them go.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium

quotes.text: You are my life now.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer,  Twilight

quotes.text: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, They have to take you in.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet

quotes.text: Writers fish for the right words like fishermen fish for, um, whatever those aquatic creatures with fins and gills are called.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the best book I've ever written, and it still sucks

quotes.text: There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quotes.text: This is what love does: It makes you want to rewrite the world. It makes you want to choose the characters, build the scenery, guide the plot. The person you love sits across from you, and you want to do everything in your power to make it possible, endlessly possible. And when it’s just the two of you, alone in a room, you can pretend that this is how it is, this is how it will be.
quotes.author: David Levithan,  Every Day

quotes.text: Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.text: When you do what you fear most, then you can do anything.
quotes.author: Stephen Richards

quotes.text: Books were safer than other people anyway.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

quotes.text: When deeds speak, words are nothing.
quotes.author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon

quotes.text: We learned about gratitude and humility - that so many people had a hand in our success, from the teachers who inspired us to the janitors who kept our school clean... and we were taught to value everyone's contribution and treat everyone with respect.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.text: Friendship is something whose depth fits human aspirations and fulfills human possibilities. It has heft to it, as a gold-piece does and a gambling chip does not.
quotes.author: Eugene Kennedy

quotes.text: If we're destroying our trees and destroying our environment and hurting animals and hurting one another and all that stuff, there's got to be a very powerful energy to fight that. I think we need more love in the world. We need more kindness, more compassion, more joy, more laughter. I definitely want to contribute to that.
quotes.author: Ellen DeGeneres

quotes.text: Sometimes I only hope to make a good popcorn movie.
quotes.author: Lou Diamond Phillips

quotes.text: Everyone is flailing through this life without an owner's manual, with whatever modicum of grace and good humor we can manage.
quotes.author: Anne Lamott

quotes.text: There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing. Defeat means to defeat the mind of contention that we harbor within.
quotes.author: Morihei Ueshiba

quotes.text: Learning to let go should be learned before learning to get. Life should be touched, not strangled. You’ve got to relax, let it happen at times, and at others move forward with it.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Too bad that all the people who know how to run the country are busy driving taxicabs and cutting hair.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.text: You'll never get ahead of anyone as long as you try to get even with him.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.text: All men who have turned out worth anything have had the chief hand in their own education.
quotes.author: Walter Scott

quotes.text: Look at me!Look at me!Look at me NOW!It is fun to have funBut you have to know how.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  The Cat in the Hat (Deluxe Edition)

quotes.text: Don't look at me in that tone of voice.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: Those who are willing to be vulnerable move among mysteries.
quotes.author: Theodore Roethke,  Straw for the Fire: From the Notebooks of Theodore Roethke

quotes.text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.
quotes.author: Seneca

quotes.text: One of the few good things about modern times: If you die horribly on television, you will not have died in vain. You will have entertained us.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quotes.text: I started my life with a single absolute: that the world was mine to shape in the image of my highest values and never to be given up to a lesser standard, no matter how long or hard the struggle.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged

quotes.text: Our true friends are those who are with us when the good things happen. They cheer us on and are pleased by our triumphs. False friends only appear at difficult times, with their sad, supportive faces, when, in fact, our suffering is serving to console them for their miserable lives.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir

quotes.text: I said to my soul, be still and wait without hope, for hope would be hope for the wrong thing; wait without love, for love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, but the faith and the love are all in the waiting. Wait without thought, for you are not ready for thought: So the darkness shall be the light, and the stillness the dancing.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.text: What was love, really? Flowers, chocolate, and poetry? Or was it something else? Was it being able to finish someone's jokes? Was it having absolute faith that someone was there at your back? Was it knowing someone so well that they instantly understood why you did the things you did—and shared those same beliefs?
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Last Sacrifice

quotes.text: To live in hearts we leave behind is not to die.
quotes.author: Thomas Campbell

quotes.text: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
quotes.author: Friedrich Schiller

quotes.text: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
quotes.author: Paul J. Meyer

quotes.text: November 11, 1802, I arrived at Judge Patterson's at Lisle. This respectable family treated me with every mark of distinction and friendship, and likewise all the people did the same. I really want for words to express my gratitude.
quotes.author: Deborah Sampson

quotes.text: I think if you show up and you work hard and you're straightforward, you can always create your own opportunities. I hope I'm right.
quotes.author: Cory Monteith

quotes.text: This life, which had been the tomb of his virtue and of his honour, is but a walking shadow; a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more: it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: You can defeat fear through humor, through pain, through honesty, bravery, intuition, and through love in the truest sense.
quotes.author: John Cassavetes

quotes.text: It's very important that we re-learn the art of resting and relaxing. Not only does it help prevent the onset of many illnesses that develop through chronic tension and worrying; it allows us to clear our minds, focus, and find creative solutions to problems.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: My name is Percy Jackson. I'm twelve years old. Until a few months ago, I was a boarding student at Yancy Academy, a private school for troubled kids in upstate New York.Am I a troubled kid?Yeah. You could say that.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief

quotes.text: You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present.
quotes.author: John Green,  Looking for Alaska

quotes.text: A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one's neighbor — such is my idea of happiness.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy,  Family Happiness

quotes.text: Music is the universal language of mankind.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: The reason that fiction is more interesting than any other form of literature, to those who really like to study people, is that in fiction the author can really tell the truth without humiliating himself.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.text: We are products of our past, but we don't have to be prisoners of it.
quotes.author: Rick Warren,  The Purpose Driven Life: What on Earth Am I Here for?

quotes.text: If you try and lose then it isn't your fault. But if you don't try and we lose, then it's all your fault.
quotes.author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game

quotes.text: Life's as kind as you let it be.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski,  Hot Water Music

quotes.text: When in danger or in doubt, run in circles, scream and shout.
quotes.author: Herman Wouk

quotes.text: Writing isn't about making money, getting famous, getting dates, getting laid, or making friends. In the end, it's about enriching the lives of those who will read your work, and enriching your own life, as well. It's about getting up, getting well, and getting over. Getting happy, okay? Getting happy.
quotes.author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quotes.text: There ain't no way you can hold onto something that wants to go, you understand? You can only love what you got while you got it.
quotes.author: Kate DiCamillo,  Because of Winn-Dixie

quotes.text: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

quotes.text: That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment.
quotes.author: Mary Ann Shaffer,  The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

quotes.text: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!
quotes.author: William Allen White

quotes.text: A graduation ceremony is an event where the commencement speaker tells thousands of students dressed in identical caps and gowns that 'individuality' is the key to success.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.text: I think 'Pretty Little Liars' is going to be hugely popular for adults, for kids, for girls, for guys, you know, something for everyone to look at, and the stories are going to be great. There's suspense every week. The friendship is really fun to watch. I think it's going to have something for everybody.
quotes.author: Laura Leighton

quotes.text: Being a father has been, without a doubt, my greatest source of achievement, pride and inspiration. Fatherhood has taught me about unconditional love, reinforced the importance of giving back and taught me how to be a better person.
quotes.author: Naveen Jain

quotes.text: I hope that Americans will give careful and well-informed thought to root causes and historical realities, in which case I think they will question why a supposedly 'legitimate' state such as Israel has had to conduct decades of war against a subject refugee population without ever achieving its goals.
quotes.author: Ismail Haniyeh

quotes.text: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Humor comes from the surprise release of some buried tension.
quotes.author: Lorrie Moore

quotes.text: I went into the business for the money, and the art grew out of it. If people are disillusioned by that remark, I can't help it. It's the truth.
quotes.author: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.text: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because generally they are the same people.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: I honestly have no idea how to live without you.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer,  New Moon

quotes.text: Many people die at twenty five and aren't buried until they are seventy five.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Fear not death for the sooner we die, the longer we shall be immortal.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I may not always be with you But when we're far apartRemember you will be with meRight inside my heart
quotes.author: Marc Wambolt,  Poems from the Heart

quotes.text: I never made one of my discoveries through the process of rational thinking
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Time is a game played beautifully by children.
quotes.author: Heraclitus,  Fragments

quotes.text: Don't use the phone. People are never ready to answer it. Use poetry.
quotes.author: Jack Kerouac

quotes.text: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching

quotes.text: It's not that you should never love something so much that it can control you.It's that you need to love something that much so you can never be controlled.It's not a weakness.It's your best strength.
quotes.author: Patrick Ness,  The Ask and the Answer

quotes.text: Let's carpe the hell out of this diem.
quotes.author: Alexandra Bracken,  The Darkest Minds

quotes.text: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.text: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
quotes.author: Emmet Fox

quotes.text: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
quotes.author: Julius Erving

quotes.text: To make us love our country, our country ought to be lovely.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.text: Testimony is an integral part of the Black religious tradition. It is the occasion where the believer stands before the community of faith in order to give account of the hope that is in him or her.
quotes.author: James Hal Cone

quotes.text: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
quotes.author: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.text: All life demands struggle. Those who have everything given to them become lazy, selfish, and insensitive to the real values of life. The very striving and hard work that we so constantly try to avoid is the major building block in the person we are today.
quotes.author: Pope Paul VI

quotes.text: Sometimes the only way to make palatable that which is appalling and apprehensive is to season it with some humor.
quotes.author: Terrence Howard

quotes.text: Growing up going to Christian school and the concept that you're born a sinner and you don't really have a choice to change who you are has been hammered into my head and created the entire reason why I made art and made a band and made records called 'Antichrist Superstar.'
quotes.author: Marilyn Manson

quotes.text: Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there.
quotes.author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

quotes.text: If I die, I will wait for you, do you understand? No matter how long. I will watch from beyond to make sure you live every year you have to its fullest, and then we’ll have so much to talk about when I see you again… (Bones)
quotes.author: Jeaniene Frost

quotes.text: We live and breathe words.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

quotes.text: Don't get your panties in such a twist... and give me back mine.
quotes.author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades of Grey

quotes.text: Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
quotes.author: J.M. Barrie

quotes.text: If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to.
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood,  The Blind Assassin

quotes.text: I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.text: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
quotes.author: Sarah Williams,  Twilight Hours: A Legacy of Verse

quotes.text: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.text: Let there be freedom for the Indians, wherever they may be in the American Continent or elsewhere in the world, because while they are alive, a glow of hope will be alive as well as a true concept of life.
quotes.author: Rigoberta Menchu

quotes.text: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Love, as wonderful and horrible as it is, has at its center a kind of pitiful humor.
quotes.author: Tim O'Brien

quotes.text: It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance... and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.text: When a girl says she wants to be friends with benefits, I always ask if that includes dental insurance.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me

quotes.text: Never trust people who smile constantly. They're either selling something or not very bright.
quotes.author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Burnt Offerings

quotes.text: Love is like a brick. You can build a house, or you can sink a dead body.
quotes.author: Lady Gaga

quotes.text: In everybody’s life there’s a point of no return. And in a very few cases, a point where you can’t go forward anymore. And when we reach that point, all we can do is quietly accept the fact. That’s how we survive.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore

quotes.text: When a woman becomes her own best friend life is easier.
quotes.author: Diane Von Furstenberg

quotes.text: This being human is a guest house. Every morning is a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor...Welcome and entertain them all. Treat each guest honorably. The dark thought, the shame, the malice, meet them at the door laughing, and invite them in. Be grateful for whoever comes, because each has been sent as a guide from beyond.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quotes.text: One day spent with someone you love can change everything.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day

quotes.text: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind

quotes.text: I have been and still am a seeker, but I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse,  Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend

quotes.text: You don't write about the horrors of war. No. You write about a kid's burnt socks lying in the road.
quotes.author: Richard Price

quotes.text: In my opinion, we don't devote nearly enough scientific research to finding a cure for jerks.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.text: Our ideals are our better selves.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott
