quotes.text: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.
quotes.author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

quotes.text: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.text: This life is like a swimming pool. You dive into the water, but you can't see how deep it is.
quotes.author: Dennis Rodman

quotes.text: Some think love can be measured by the amount of butterflies in their tummy. Others think love can be measured in bunches of flowers, or by using the words 'for ever.' But love can only truly be measured by actions. It can be a small thing, such as peeling an orange for a person you love because you know they don't like doing it.
quotes.author: Marian Keyes

quotes.text: Jon Stewart, Bill Maher, Stephen Colbert. Those are the guys I look at who are telling me pretty much the truth. And they throw humor into it which makes it much more interesting to listen to.
quotes.author: Grace Slick

quotes.text: Because theatre is a story-telling art form, we feel entitled to assume that the playwright got there before we got there.
quotes.author: Tom Stoppard

quotes.text: How can I be reasonable? To me our love was everything and you were my whole life. It is not very pleasant to realize that to you it was only an episode.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham,  The Painted Veil

quotes.text: We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
quotes.author: Carlos Castaneda

quotes.text: His heart danced upon her movements like a cork upon a tide. He heard what her eyes said to him from beneath their cowl and knew that in some dim past, whether in life or revery, he had heard their tale before.
quotes.author: James Joyce,  A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man

quotes.text: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
quotes.author: Judy Garland

quotes.text: Whether you live to be 50 or 100 makes no difference, if you made no difference in the world.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women

quotes.text: I'm choosing happiness over suffering, I know I am. I'm making space for the unknown future to fill up my life with yet-to-come surprises.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: I hate writing, I love having written.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: Owning our story can be hard but not nearly as difficult as spending our lives running from it. Embracing our vulnerabilities is risky but not nearly as dangerous as giving up on love and belonging and joy—the experiences that make us the most vulnerable. Only when we are brave enough to explore the darkness will we discover the infinite power of our light.
quotes.author: Brené Brown

quotes.text: Books can also provoke emotions. And emotions sometimes are even more troublesome than ideas. Emotions have led people to do all sorts of things they later regret-like, oh, throwing a book at someone else.
quotes.author: Pseudonymous Bosch,  The Name of This Book Is Secret

quotes.text: I have found out that there ain't no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.
quotes.author: Mark Twain,  Tom Sawyer Abroad

quotes.text: Facts are like cows. If you look them in the face long enough, they generally run away.
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.text: The surest way of concealing from others the boundaries of one's own knowledge is not to overstep them.
quotes.author: Giacomo Leopardi

quotes.text: Easy reading is damn hard writing.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.text: Silence is the last thing the world will ever hear from me.
quotes.author: Marlee Matlin

quotes.text: I try to give people hope. Even though life is bleak, there's hope out there.
quotes.author: Danielle Steel

quotes.text: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
quotes.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.text: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
quotes.author: Henry Rollins

quotes.text: The secret to a happy marriage is if you can be at peace with someone within four walls, if you are content because the one you love is near to you, either upstairs or downstairs, or in the same room, and you feel that warmth that you don't find very often, then that is what love is all about.
quotes.author: Bruce Forsyth

quotes.text: I think humor can be an effective way of getting the point across, but there are definitely times where I just write very earnestly.
quotes.author: Alex Pareene

quotes.text: To play safe, I prefer to accept only one type of power: the power of art over trash, the triumph of magic over the brute.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.text: When you have seen as much of life as I have, you will not underestimate the power of obsessive love.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

quotes.text: Like all of my friends, she's a lousy judge of character.
quotes.author: David Sedaris,  Me Talk Pretty One Day

quotes.text: This is my knife. It is very sharp and very eager to hurt you.
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket,  The Reptile Room

quotes.text: Love truth, but pardon error.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.text: He's not your prince charming if he doesn't make sure you know that you're his princess.
quotes.author: Demi Lovato

quotes.text: My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Faust: First Part

quotes.text: What you have to decide... is how you want your life to be. If your forever was ending tomorrow, would this be how you'd want to have spent it? Listen, the truth is, nothing is guaranteed. You know that more than anybody. So dont be afraid. Be alive.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

quotes.text: Whoever is happy will make others happy.
quotes.author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of a Young Girl

quotes.text: On the recollection of so many and great favours and blessings, I now, with a high sense of gratitude, presume to offer up my sincere thanks to the Almighty, the Creator and Preserver.
quotes.author: William Bartram

quotes.text: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
quotes.author: Jane D. Hull

quotes.text: I hope that any expansion of London will learn from the planning examples of some of its most desirable areas such as Chelsea, Notting Hill, Belgravia and Mayfair. All are characterised by high density and a generosity of green spaces. They are all pedestrian-friendly with shops, entertainment, restaurants and pubs within easy walking distance.
quotes.author: Norman Foster

quotes.text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: I'm most proud of the blessings that God has bestowed upon me, in my life. He's given me the vision to truly see that you can fall down, but you can still get back up. Hopefully I'll learn from my mistakes and have the opportunity to strengthen and improve the next thing I do.
quotes.author: Martin Lawrence

quotes.text: We should remember that saying 'I love you' is only a beginning. We need to say it, we need to mean it, and most importantly we need consistently to show it. We need to both express and demonstrate love.
quotes.author: David A. Bednar

quotes.text: I can't not put humor in a book.
quotes.author: Albert Brooks

quotes.text: I try to keep a low profile in general. Not with my art, but just as a person.
quotes.author: Alanis Morissette

quotes.text: The world is a tragedy to those who feel, but a comedy to those who think.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.text: There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: I have claimed that Escape is one of the main functions of fairy-stories, and since I do not disapprove of them, it is plain that I do not accept the tone of scorn or pity with which 'Escape' is now so often used. Why should a man be scorned if, finding himself in prison, he tries to get out and go home? Or if he cannot do so, he thinks and talks about other topics than jailers and prison-walls?
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.text: I wonder why I don't go to bed and go to sleep. But then it would be tomorrow, so I decide that no matter how tired, no matter how incoherent I am, I can skip on hour more of sleep and live.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: I think happiness is what makes you pretty. Period. Happy people are beautiful. They become like a mirror and they reflect that happiness.
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.text: Anyone can speak Troll. All you have to do is point and grunt.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

quotes.text: You know, sometimes kids get bad grades in school because the class moves too slow for them. Einstein got D's in school. Well guess what, I get F's!!!
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.text: If the road is easy, you're likely going the wrong way.
quotes.author: Terry Goodkind

quotes.text: Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha

quotes.text: Yeah? Can you draw a skeleton riding a motorcycle with flames coming out of it? And I want a pirate hat on the skeleton. And a parrot on his shoulder. A skeleton parrot. Or maybe a ninja skeleton parrot? No, that would be overkill. But it'd be cool if the biker skeleton could be shooting some ninja throwing stars. That are on fire.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Bloodlines

quotes.text: The world was a terrible place, cruel, pitiless, dark as a bad dream. Not a good place to live. Only in books could you find pity, comfort, happiness - and love. Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you security and friendship and didn't ask anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly.
quotes.author: Cornelia Funke,  The Inkheart Trilogy: Inkheart, Inkspell, Inkdeath

quotes.text: The great thing to remember is that though our feelings come and go God's love for us does not.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
quotes.author: Han Suyin

quotes.text: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
quotes.author: Arthur Ashe

quotes.text: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.
quotes.author: Bob Riley

quotes.text: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
quotes.author: Richard Burton

quotes.text: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
quotes.author: Kevyn Aucoin

quotes.text: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
quotes.author: Ella Fitzgerald

quotes.text: I don't think I would describe my sense of humor. Doesn't sound like the kind of thing I'd do.
quotes.author: Tommy Lee Jones

quotes.text: You know, Castle's the kind of guy that when he meets somebody, that's a connection for him. He remains connected to the people that he meets. That's the kind of guy he is, be they criminals, gangster rappers, mafia guys, art thieves, whoever it is, he nurtures those relationships.
quotes.author: Nathan Fillion

quotes.text: I can see how it might be possible for a man to look down upon the earth and be an atheist, but I cannot conceive how a man could look up into the heavens and say there is no God.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw,  Man and Superman

quotes.text: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
quotes.author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

quotes.text: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: She burned too bright for this world.
quotes.author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights

quotes.text: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.text: There's more to life than dating the boy on the football team.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it.
quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor,  The Habit of Being: Letters of Flannery O'Connor

quotes.text: But how could you live and have no story to tell?
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  White Nights

quotes.text: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right times.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Wise Man's Fear

quotes.text: Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.text: I hope you love birds too. It is economical. It saves going to heaven.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
quotes.author: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.text: Winning is great, sure, but if you are really going to do something in life, the secret is learning how to lose. Nobody goes undefeated all the time. If you can pick up after a crushing defeat, and go on to win again, you are going to be a champion someday.
quotes.author: Wilma Rudolph

quotes.text: With Ricky Gervais, it's all shades of wrong, it's my kind of humor.
quotes.author: Emily Blunt

quotes.text: I remember that - you know, I didn't receive a formal education. I was educated in the Montevideo cafe, in the cafes of Montevideo. There, I received my first lessons in the art of telling stories, storytelling.
quotes.author: Eduardo Galeano

quotes.text: The strongest love is the love that can demonstrate its fragility.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes

quotes.text: Those who do not weep, do not see.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

quotes.text: As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all - the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quotes.text: Anon, who wrote so many poems without signing them, was often a woman.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

quotes.text: When you love someone you let them take care of you.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult

quotes.text: For me, it is far better to grasp the Universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark

quotes.text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: You're on Earth. There's no cure for that.
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: I told her I'd wait forever for her, but that was before I found somebody else who'd give me a ride home.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quotes.text: Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quotes.text: When you can live forever what do you live for?
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer

quotes.text: It's the imperfections that make things beautiful
quotes.author: Jenny Han,  The Summer I Turned Pretty

quotes.text: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson,  Selected Letters

quotes.text: A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes

quotes.text: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

quotes.text: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.text: We need to keep hope alive and strive to do better.
quotes.author: Kofi Annan

quotes.text: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
quotes.author: Francesco Guicciardini

quotes.text: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: Feature-length film comedy is harder to pull off than the episodic sitcom - it doesn't have the same factory machinery up and running, teams of writers putting familiar characters through permutations - but that doesn't explain the widening quality gap that makes movie humor look like a genetic defective.
quotes.author: James Wolcott

quotes.text: My hobbies away from horse racing would be reading and painting; I love art.
quotes.author: Chantal Sutherland

quotes.text: In real life, I assure you, there is no such thing as algebra.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.text: Ignoring isn’t the same as ignorance, you have to work at it.
quotes.author: Margaret Atwood,  The Handmaid's Tale

quotes.text: Three things can not hide for long: the Moon, the Sun and the Truth.
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: Since I was young, I have always known this: Life damages us, every one. We can’t escape that damage. But now, I am also learning this: We can be mended. We mend each other
quotes.author: Veronica Roth

quotes.text: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win;Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.
quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.text: Any word you have to hunt for in a thesaurus is the wrong word. There are no exceptions to this rule.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: Oh the places you'll go! There is fun to be done! There are points to be scored. There are games to be won. And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You’ll Go!

quotes.text: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: I love you more than I think I should.
quotes.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,  Crescendo

quotes.text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books.
quotes.author: Jasper Fforde,  The Eyre Affair

quotes.text: He was mastered by the sheer surging of life, the tidal wave of being, the perfect joy of each separate muscle, joint, and sinew in that it was everything that was not death, that it was aglow and rampant, expressing itself in movement, flying exultantly under the stars.
quotes.author: Jack London,  The Call of the Wild

quotes.text: You know that old saying. Once you go dead, no one's better in bed.
quotes.author: Jeaniene Frost,  One Foot in the Grave

quotes.text: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.text: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: From faith, hope, and love, the virtues of religion referring to God, there arises a double act which bears on the spiritual communion exercised between God and us; the hearing of the word and prayer.
quotes.author: William Ames

quotes.text: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.text: We are at our very best, and we are happiest, when we are fully engaged in work we enjoy on the journey toward the goal we've established for ourselves. It gives meaning to our time off and comfort to our sleep. It makes everything else in life so wonderful, so worthwhile.
quotes.author: Earl Nightingale

quotes.text: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: Twitter is the place where I try to be more funny. And then I use Instagram just as my diary. I pull some jokes on there, but I think people have a better sense of humor on Twitter.
quotes.author: Gigi Hadid

quotes.text: If you have good songs and a real desire to make music, the next thing to do, instead of approach record companies, is to get yourself a really good manager because then it allows you to focus on your profession of being a musician. Then they can focus on the darker art of the record label and the music industry.
quotes.author: James Blunt

quotes.text: Don't leave a piece of jewelry at his house so you can go back and get it later; he may be with his real girlfriend.
quotes.author: Amy Sedaris,  I Like You: Hospitality Under the Influence

quotes.text: I mean, really. Who sends their kid to boarding school? It's so Hogwarts. Only mine doesn't have cute boy wizards or magic candy or flying lessons.
quotes.author: Stephanie Perkins,  Anna and the French Kiss

quotes.text: You can never really know someone completely. That’s why it’s the most terrifying thing in the world, really—taking someone on faith, hoping they’ll take you on faith too. It’s such a precarious balance, It’s a wonder we do it at all. And yet..
quotes.author: Libba Bray

quotes.text: Often, it’s not about becoming a new person, but becoming the person you were meant to be, and already are, but don’t know how to be.
quotes.author: Heath L. Buckmaster,  Box of Hair: A Fairy Tale

quotes.text: Properly read, the Bible is the most potent force for atheism ever conceived.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: Do not go gentle into that good night,Old age should burn and rave at close of day;Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
quotes.author: Dylan Thomas,  Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night

quotes.text: I don't care if you're black, white, straight, bisexual, gay, lesbian, short, tall, fat, skinny, rich or poor. If you're nice to me, I'll be nice to you. Simple as that.
quotes.author: Robert Michaels MD - 2007 - Graduation Speaker

quotes.text: She didn't belong anywhere and she never really belonged to anyone. And everyone else belonged somewhere and to someone. People thought she was too wonderful. But she only wanted to belong to someone. People always thought she was too wonderful to belong to them or that something too wonderful would hurt too much to lose. And that's why she liked him-- because he just thought she was crazy.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: Getting something and having the wits to use it...those are two different things.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Battle of the Labyrinth

quotes.text: I went to a bookstore and asked the saleswoman, 'Where's the self-help section?' She said if she told me, it would defeat the purpose.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.text: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.text: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
quotes.author: Michael Jackson

quotes.text: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's the determination and commitment to unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
quotes.author: Mario Andretti

quotes.text: I hope people half my age and twice my age will listen to my music - I want it to live forever and for my audience to feel like they have a friend in my music. Music is a spirit. It heals. It's an amazing thing to be loved and appreciated, and sometimes, music has not just been my best friend, it's been my only friend.
quotes.author: Hunter Hayes

quotes.text: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: Always keep your smile. That's how I explain my long life.
quotes.author: Jeanne Calment

quotes.text: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quotes.text: We get to live in a time that we get to use social media as a tool. It's not just a face on a piece of paper, and that's what makes you someone's favorite model. We can have a very similar sense of humor as someone, and that's why we're their favorite model, or our personal style, off the runway, is why we're their favorite.
quotes.author: Gigi Hadid

quotes.text: I've learned that I'm most powerful when I'm doing my art.
quotes.author: Andre Benjamin

quotes.text: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quotes.text: Some people feel like they don't deserve love. They walk away quietly into empty spaces, trying to close the gaps of the past.
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

quotes.text: It is an occupational hazard that anyone who has spent her life learning how to lie eventually becomes bad at telling the truth.
quotes.author: Ally Carter,  Heist Society

quotes.text: Gentle reader, may you never feel what I then felt! May your eyes never shed such stormy, scalding, heart-wrung tears as poured from mine. May you never appeal to Heaven in prayers so hopeless and so agised as in that hour left my lips: for never may you, like me, dread to be the instrument of evil to what you wholly love.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: I can't decide whether I'm a good girl wrapped up in a bad girl, or if I'm a bad girl wrapped up in a good girl. And that's how I know I'm a woman!
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: If I saw you hitchhiking, I’d smile and return your thumb’s up, just for you doing such a great job of being a positive roadside influence.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.text: Then, one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...you give them a piece of you. They don't ask for it. They do something dumb one day like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 9: The Kindly Ones

quotes.text: What's the world's greatest lie?... It's this: that at a certain point in our lives, we lose control of what's happening to us, and our lives become controlled by fate.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: One day, when I am a braver man, I will tell her these things, and then I will look her in the eye tell her I love her and ask her to be only mine. But until that day, we're just friends.
quotes.author: Charlie Huston,  Already Dead

quotes.text: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
quotes.author: Meister Eckhart

quotes.text: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
quotes.author: Joyce Brothers

quotes.text: I've got a lot of dreams I want to achieve, and I hope someone can cheer me on as I'll cheer them on in their dreams.
quotes.author: Hunter Hayes

quotes.text: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
quotes.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

quotes.text: Ingmar Bergman had a great sense of humor, and he had a very special, characteristic laugh that you always recognized - if he went to watch a theater show, 'Ah! He is here tonight.'
quotes.author: Max von Sydow

quotes.text: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: Goodbyes are only for those who love with their eyes. Because for those who love with heart and soul there is no such thing as separation.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: The whole of life is just like watching a film. Only it's as though you always get in ten minutes after the big picture has started, and no-one will tell you the plot, so you have to work it out all yourself from the clues.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett,  Moving Pictures

quotes.text: One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas I'll never know.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: You always get more respect when you don't have a happy ending.
quotes.author: Julia Quinn

quotes.text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: There is a way to be good again...
quotes.author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner

quotes.text: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quotes.text: It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: I like to have a martini,Two at the very most.After three I'm under the table,after four I'm under my host.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker,  The Collected Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.text: And out of that hopeless attempt has come nearly all that we call human history—money, poverty, ambition, war, prostitution, classes, empires, slavery—the long terrible story of man trying to find something other than God which will make him happy.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity

quotes.text: People tell you the world looks a certain way. Parents tell you how to think. Schools tell you how to think. TV. Religion. And then at a certain point, if you're lucky, you realize you can make up your own mind. Nobody sets the rules but you. You can design your own life.
quotes.author: Carrie-Anne Moss

quotes.text: The best revenge is massive success.
quotes.author: Frank Sinatra

quotes.text: We're in an emergency situation. The United States has become an absolutely terrifying country, and I would hope that I could participate in some way in stopping the horror and the brutality.
quotes.author: Wallace Shawn

quotes.text: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: We, the People, recognize that we have responsibilities as well as rights; that our destinies are bound together; that a freedom which only asks what's in it for me, a freedom without a commitment to others, a freedom without love or charity or duty or patriotism, is unworthy of our founding ideals, and those who died in their defense.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: I visited Jobs for the last time in his Palo Alto, Calif., home. He had moved to a downstairs bedroom because he was too weak to go up and down stairs. He was curled up in some pain, but his mind was still sharp and his humor vibrant.
quotes.author: Walter Isaacson

quotes.text: Many artists and scholars have pointed out that ultimately art depends on human nature.
quotes.author: Steven Pinker

quotes.text: I'm the most terrific liar you ever saw in your life. It's awful. If I'm on my way to the store to buy a magazine, even, and somebody asks me where I'm going, I'm liable to say I'm going to the opera. It's terrible.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger,  The Catcher in the Rye

quotes.text: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: You've a good heart. Sometimes that's enough to see you safe wherever you go. But mostly, it's not.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  Neverwhere

quotes.text: I’m in love with you, and I know that love is just a shout into the void, and that oblivion is inevitable, and that we’re all doomed and that there will come a day when all our labor has been returned to dust, and I know the sun will swallow the only earth we’ll ever have, and I am in love with you.
quotes.author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quotes.text: We die to each other daily. What we know of other people is only our memory of the moments during which we knew them. And they have changed since then. To pretend that they and we are the same is a useful and convenient social convention which must sometimes be broken. We must also remember that at every meeting we are meeting a stranger.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot,  The Cocktail Party

quotes.text: It is only a novel... or, in short, only some work in which the greatest powers of the mind are displayed, in which the most thorough knowledge of human nature, the happiest delineation of its varieties, the liveliest effusions of wit and humour, are conveyed to the world in the best-chosen language
quotes.author: Jane Austen,  Northanger Abbey

quotes.text: Be like the sun for grace and mercy. Be like the night to cover others' faults. Be like running water for generosity. Be like death for rage and anger. Be like the Earth for modesty. Appear as you are. Be as you appear.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
quotes.author: W.C. Fields

quotes.text: I belong to the people I love, and they belong to me--they, and the love and loyaty I give them, form my identity far more than any word or group ever could.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

quotes.text: Knowledge is power. Power to do evil...or power to do good. Power itself is not evil. So knowledge itself is not evil.
quotes.author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

quotes.text: So comes snow after fire, and even dragons have their endings.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Hobbit

quotes.text: Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet. Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.
quotes.author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quotes.text: Here's something else to think about: calling when you say you're going to is the very first brick in the house you are building of love and trust. If he can't lay this one stupid brick down, you ain't never gonna have a house baby, and it's cold outside.
quotes.author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys

quotes.text: I'm a poet, and I like my lies the way my mother used to make them.
quotes.author: Aleister Crowley,  Moonchild

quotes.text: The rain to the wind said,You push and I'll pelt.'They so smote the garden bedThat the flowers actually knelt,And lay lodged--though not dead.I know how the flowers felt.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Writing a book is a horrible, exhausting struggle, like a long bout with some painful illness. One would never undertake such a thing if one were not driven on by some demon whom one can neither resist nor understand.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: I met an old lady once, almost a hundred years old, and she told me, 'There are only two questions that human beings have ever fought over, all through history. How much do you love me? And Who's in charge?
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: Together, they would watch everything that was so carefully planned collapse, and they would smile at the beauty of destruction.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quotes.text: Is God willing to prevent evil, but not able? Then he is not omnipotent. Is he able, but not willing? Then he is malevolent. Is he both able and willing? Then whence cometh evil? Is he neither able nor willing? Then why call him God?
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: I think it's perfectly possible to explain how the universe came about without bringing God into it, but I don't know everything, and there may well be a God somewhere, hiding away. Actually, if he is keeping out of sight, it's because he's ashamed of his followers and all the cruelty and ignorance they're responsible for promoting in his name. If I were him, I'd want nothing to do with them.
quotes.author: Philip Pullman

quotes.text: Of all human activities, man's listening to God is the supreme act of his reasoning and will.
quotes.author: Pope Paul VI

quotes.text: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: I hope there's a tinge of disgrace about me. Hopefully, there's one good scandal left in me yet.
quotes.author: Diana Rigg

quotes.text: There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.
quotes.author: Bryant H. McGill

quotes.text: Humor's an excellent way to make a point more palatable and/or relatable.
quotes.author: Jen Lancaster

quotes.text: A painter's tastes must grow out of what so obsesses him in life that he never has to ask himself what it is suitable for him to do in art.
quotes.author: Lucian Freud

quotes.text: To perceive is to suffer.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
quotes.author: George Orwell,  In Front of Your Nose: 1945-1950

quotes.text: I know it seems hard sometimes but remember one thing. Through every dark night, there's a bright day after that. So no matter how hard it get, stick your chest out, keep ya head up.... and handle it.
quotes.author: Tupac Shakur

quotes.text: I like to call in sick to work at places where I’ve never held a job. Then when the manager tells me I don’t work there, I tell them I’d like to. But not today, as I’m sick.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quotes.text: In this world, it is too common for people to search for someone to lose themselves in. But I am already lost. I will look for someone to find myself in.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens
quotes.author: Tony DeLiso,  Legacy: The Power Within

quotes.text: So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.
quotes.author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly

quotes.text: If sex were shoes, I'd wear you out. But I wouldn't wear you out in public.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.text: She said this in the same way you might say Fields of Punishment or Hades's gym shorts.
quotes.author: Rick Riordan,  The Titan's Curse

quotes.text: Falling for him would be like cliff diving. It would be either the most exhilarating thing that ever happened to me or the stupidest mistake I’d ever make.
quotes.author: Colleen Houck

quotes.text: If there were an international butt competition, Eric would win, hands down—or cheeks up.
quotes.author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead to the World

quotes.text: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.
quotes.author: Ben Okri

quotes.text: The American Dream is one of success, home ownership, college education for one's children, and have a secure job to provide these and other goals.
quotes.author: Leonard Boswell

quotes.text: We live in a world of constant juxtaposition between joy that's possible and pain that's all too common. We hope for love and success and abundance, but we never quite forget that there is always lurking the possibility of disaster.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
quotes.author: Plautus

quotes.text: Happiness is a choice. You can choose to be happy. There's going to be stress in life, but it's your choice whether you let it affect you or not.
quotes.author: Valerie Bertinelli

quotes.text: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.text: I'm a humor writer, so I don't always present myself in the best light.
quotes.author: Jen Lancaster

quotes.text: The art of bread making can become a consuming hobby, and no matter how often and how many kinds of bread one has made, there always seems to be something new to learn.
quotes.author: Julia Child

quotes.text: Make a pact with yourself today to not be defined by your past. Sometimes the greatest thing to come out of all your hard work isn't what you get for it, but what you become for it. Shake things up today! Be You...Be Free...Share.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quotes.text: If you're going to be crazy, you have to get paid for it or else you're going to be locked up.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.text: The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isn't true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: If you don’t like to read, you haven’t found the right book.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.text: The meaning of life is that it stops.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: So that's little Scorpious. Make sure you beat him in every test, Rosie. Thank god you've inherited your mother's brains.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: In secret we met -In silence I grieve,That thy heart could forget,Thy spirit deceive.If I should meet theeAfter long years,How should I greet thee? -With silence and tears
quotes.author: George Gordon Byron

quotes.text: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
quotes.author: André Gide

quotes.text: Romance novels are birthday cake and life is often peanut butter and jelly. I think everyone should have lots of delicious romance novels lying around for those times when the peanut butter of life gets stuck to the roof of your mouth.
quotes.author: Janet Evanovich

quotes.text: There's nothing more embarrassing than to have earned the disfavor of a perceptive animal.
quotes.author: Michael Chabon,  Wonder Boys

quotes.text: My argument against God was that the universe seemed so cruel and unjust. But how had I got this idea of just and unjust? A man does not call a line crooked unless he has some idea of a straight line. What was I comparing this universe with when I called it unjust?
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity

quotes.text: If I am to be fallen into love, I will. And if as a result I will appear to be stupid, disillusioned, and of poor judgment, I will. And I would be damned if I cared what other people think. For I would rather be thought of as all of these things, than not love. If in loving, I become the naked woman on the horse, I will ride that horse with my head held high. This is my spirit. I am unbreakable.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: The voice of Love seemed to call to me, but it was a wrong number.
quotes.author: P.G. Wodehouse,  Very Good, Jeeves!

quotes.text: I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me.
quotes.author: Zane Grey

quotes.text: I was sure I'd set the world on fire, and it was hard for a young feller like me to realize the truth - that I hadn't set the world on fire, and I was totally unprepared to handle the consequences if 'The Big Trail' had been a success and launched me as a star.
quotes.author: John Wayne

quotes.text: I hope to make people realize how totally helpless animals are, how dependent on us, trusting as a child must that we will be kind and take care of their needs.
quotes.author: James Herriot

quotes.text: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
quotes.author: E. W. Howe

quotes.text: When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.
quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

quotes.text: If I can't see the humor in it, how am I going to be funny?
quotes.author: Casey Affleck

quotes.text: In the end, nature is inexorable: it has no reason to hurry and, sooner or later, it takes what belongs to it. Unconsciously and inflexibly obedient to its own laws, it doesn't know art, just as it doesn't know freedom, just as it doesn't know goodness.
quotes.author: Ivan Turgenev

quotes.text: The love that moves the sun and the other stars.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.text: For never was a story of more woe than this of Juliet and her Romeo.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

quotes.text: I'm not in search of sanctity, sacredness, purity; these things are found after this life, not in this life; but in this life I search to be completely human: to feel, to give, to take, to laugh, to get lost, to be found, to dance, to love and to lust, to be so human.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: Atheism is more than just the knowledge that gods do not exist, and that religion is either a mistake or a fraud. Atheism is an attitude, a frame of mind that looks at the world objectively, fearlessly, always trying to understand all things as a part of nature.
quotes.author: Emmett F. Fields

quotes.text: One should never trust a woman who tells one her real age. A woman who would tell one that would tell one anything.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why not now?
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.text: All you have in comedy, in general, is just going with your instincts. You can only hope that other people think that what you think is funny is funny. I don't have an answer but I just try to plough straight ahead.
quotes.author: Will Ferrell

quotes.text: Where would you be without friends? The people to pick you up when you need lifting? We come from homes far from perfect, so you end up almost parent and sibling to your friends - your own chosen family. There's nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend. Nothing.
quotes.author: Jennifer Aniston

quotes.text: Red is such an interesting color to correlate with emotion, because it's on both ends of the spectrum. On one end you have happiness, falling in love, infatuation with someone, passion, all that. On the other end, you've got obsession, jealousy, danger, fear, anger and frustration.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: Life is never all one thing. It bounces around. Certainly, my own life has. Look at Woody Allen's funny movies - all the humor comes out of sad stuff. Sometimes you have to laugh, no matter what life deals you.
quotes.author: Tim O'Brien

quotes.text: A rose is the visible result of an infinitude of complicated goings on in the bosom of the earth and in the air above, and similarly a work of art is the product of strange activities in the human mind.
quotes.author: Clive Bell

quotes.text: So much good, so much evil. Just add water.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quotes.text: This planet has - or rather had - a problem, which was this: most of the people living on it were unhappy for pretty much of the time. Many solutions were suggested for this problem, but most of these were largely concerned with the movement of small green pieces of paper, which was odd because on the whole it wasn't the small green pieces of paper that were unhappy.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: Last time I saw you, I said that it hurt too much to love you. But I was wrong about that. The truth is it hurts too much not to love you.
quotes.author: P.C. Cast

quotes.text: Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Live not for Battles Won.Live not for The-End-of-the-Song. Live in the along.
quotes.author: Gwendolyn Brooks,  Report from Part One

quotes.text: Your life is an occasion. Rise to it.
quotes.author: Suzanne Weyn,  Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium

quotes.text: How far should a person go in the name of true love?
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Choice

quotes.text: With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,it is still a beautiful world.Be cheerful.Strive to be happy.
quotes.author: Max Ehrmann,  Desiderata: A Poem for a Way of Life

quotes.text: The truth doesn't always set you free; people prefer to believe prettier, neatley wrapped lies
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult,  Keeping Faith

quotes.text: Of course it hurt that we could never love each other in a physical way. We would have been far more happy if we had. But that was like the tides, the change of seasons--something immutable, an immovable destiny we could never alter. No matter how cleverly we might shelter it, our delicate friendship wasn't going to last forever. We were bound to reach a dead end. That was painfully clear.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Sputnik Sweetheart

quotes.text: nothing in this world was more difficult than love.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez

quotes.text: The heaviness of loss in her heart hadn't eased, but there was room there for humour, too.
quotes.author: Nalo Hopkinson,  Brown Girl in the Ring

quotes.text: Never dull your shine for somebody else.
quotes.author: Tyra Banks

quotes.text: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.text: The biggest start-up successes - from Henry Ford to Bill Gates to Mark Zuckerberg - were pioneered by people from solidly middle-class backgrounds. These founders were not wealthy when they began. They were hungry for success, but knew they had a solid support system to fall back on if they failed.
quotes.author: Eric Ries

quotes.text: We need to move into a culture of peace. What I hope to promote is the idea that we all need each other and that the greatest happiness in life is not how much we have but how much we give. That's a wealth that's priceless. You can't buy compassion.
quotes.author: Herbie Hancock

quotes.text: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
quotes.author: Judy Holliday

quotes.text: Our heavenly Father understands our disappointment, suffering, pain, fear, and doubt. He is always there to encourage our hearts and help us understand that He's sufficient for all of our needs. When I accepted this as an absolute truth in my life, I found that my worrying stopped.
quotes.author: Charles Stanley

quotes.text: Texas humor and Southern humor are pretty similar.
quotes.author: Daniel Woodrell

quotes.text: Society is like a large piece of frozen water; and skating well is the great art of social life.
quotes.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quotes.text: The funniest people are the saddest ones
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: It is easy enough to be friendly to one's friends. But to befriend the one who regards himself as your enemy is the quintessence of true religion. The other is mere business.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together,but do so with all your heart.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

quotes.text: Books are finite, sexual encounters are finite, but the desire to read and to fuck is infinite; it surpasses our own deaths, our fears, our hopes for peace.
quotes.author: Roberto Bolaño

quotes.text: Someday, we’ll run into each other again, I know it.Maybe I’ll be older and smarter and just plain better. If that happens,that’s when I’ll deserve you. But now, at this moment, you can’t hook your boat to mine, because I’m liable to sink us both.
quotes.author: Gabrielle Zevin,  Memoirs of a Teenage Amnesiac

quotes.text: I didn't fail the test, I just found 100 ways to do it wrong.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Love is heavy and light, bright and dark, hot and cold, sick and healthy, asleep and awake- its everything except what it is! (Act 1, scene 1)
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

quotes.text: Let’s start with this statistic: You are delicious. Be brave, my sweet. I know you can get lonely. I know you can crave companionship and sex and love so badly that it physically hurts. But I truly believe that the only way you can find out that there’s something better out there is to first believe there’s something better out there. What other choice is there?
quotes.author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You

quotes.text: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass...It's about learning to dance in the rain.
quotes.author: Vivian Greene

quotes.text: Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando

quotes.text: Forgive the past. It is over. Learn from it and let go. People are constantly changing and growing. Do not cling to a limited, disconnected, negative image of a person in the past. See that person now. Your relationship is always alive and changing.
quotes.author: Brian L. Weiss,  Messages from the Masters: Tapping Into the Power of Love

quotes.text: I'm gonna fight for you, until your heart stops beating.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer,  Eclipse

quotes.text: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
quotes.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quotes.text: Fame or perceived success - it all comes from groupthink.
quotes.author: Chance The Rapper

quotes.text: I do hope that our spring will be starting shortly and we will all be able to enjoy some sunshine again.
quotes.author: Lesley Garrett

quotes.text: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.text: Too often in life, something happens and we blame other people for us not being happy or satisfied or fulfilled. So the point is, we all have choices, and we make the choice to accept people or situations or to not accept situations.

quotes.text: My friends and family are my support system. They tell me what I need to hear, not what I want to hear and they are there for me in the good and bad times. Without them I have no idea where I would be and I know that their love for me is what's keeping my head above the water.

quotes.text: I can't begin to tell you how fulfilling the perennial nature of 'Elf' on television has been for me. It's great to be able to connect parents with children both emotionally and through humor.

quotes.text: When we hear some beautiful piece of Mozart or admire a wonderful building, we suddenly become present in ourselves. That's unusual nowadays because dishevelment and distraction have become an art form.

quotes.text: Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: Personally, I'm always ready to learn, although I do not always like being taught.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.text: I dont think that we're meant to understand it all the time. I think that sometimes we just have to have faith.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  A Walk to Remember

quotes.text: A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: The Christian ideal has not been tried and found wanting. It has been found difficult; and left untried.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton,  What's Wrong with the World

quotes.text: You were given life; it is your duty (and also your entitlement as a human being) to find something beautiful within life, no matter how slight.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.text: I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself.

quotes.text: We’ll never survive!” “Nonsense. You’re only saying that because no one ever has.
quotes.author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quotes.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.text: If I were a carpenter, I would build you a window to my soul. But I would leave that window shut and locked, so that every time you tried to look through it all you would see is your own reflection. You would see that my soul is a reflection of you.
quotes.author: Colleen Hoover,  Point of Retreat

quotes.text: Sleep my little baby-ohSleep until you wakenWhen you wake you'll see the worldIf I'm not mistaken...Kiss a loverDance a measure,Find your nameAnd buried treasure...Face your lifeIts pain, Its pleasure,Leave no path untaken.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book

quotes.text: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong.
quotes.author: Christopher Moore

quotes.text: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.text: It goes without saying that it's hard to attain a certain level of success.
quotes.author: T.I.

quotes.text: I never make a movie for awards consideration. I will use the hope of getting an Academy Award a) to honor the people who work so hard and also b) it's the greatest Good Housekeeping seal in the world. It's the greatest brand. It's as good as Louis Vuitton and Dior in the world of moviemaking. It's the Super Bowl.
quotes.author: Harvey Weinstein

quotes.text: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.text: The greatest thing about where my life is right now is it's very relaxed and chill. I'm just hanging out, being myself and doing my work.
quotes.author: Lucas Grabeel

quotes.text: A deep sense of love and belonging is an irreducible need of all people. We are biologically, cognitively, physically, and spiritually wired to love, to be loved, and to belong. When those needs are not met, we don't function as we were meant to. We break. We fall apart. We numb. We ache. We hurt others. We get sick.
quotes.author: Brene Brown

quotes.text: The ultimate storyteller is Shakespeare, who was able to get the 'groundlings' to laugh at his bawdy humor and storylines but could still be studied by scholars to this day for the complexity of his language, meter, and symbolism. That's the real guy.
quotes.author: Jon Favreau

quotes.text: I think it's difficult to do fashion for men, because either you become very over-homosexual fashion or very boring fashion. You don't want a boy who looks 15 in a little pair of shorts with some strange art... But to see just a jacket and tie is boring.
quotes.author: Carine Roitfeld

quotes.text: To love is to suffer. To avoid suffering one must not love. But then one suffers from not loving. Therefore, to love is to suffer; not to love is to suffer; to suffer is to suffer. To be happy is to love. To be happy, then, is to suffer, but suffering makes one unhappy. Therefore, to be happy one must love or love to suffer or suffer from too much happiness.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: If this is going to be a Christian nation that doesn't help the poor, either we have to pretend that Jesus was just as selfish as we are, or we've got to acknowledge that He commanded us to love the poor and serve the needy without condition and then admit that we just don't want to do it.
quotes.author: Stephen Colbert

quotes.text: I don't care what you say to me. I care what you share with me.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

quotes.text: In this hour, I do not believe that any darkness will endure.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King

quotes.text: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Our lives are not as limited as we think they are; the world is a wonderfully weird place; consensual reality is significantly flawed; no institution can be trusted, but love does work; all things are possible; and we all could be happy and fulfilled if we only had the guts to be truly free and the wisdom to shrink our egos and quit taking ourselves so damn seriously.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.text: When you make music or write or create, it's really your job to have mind-blowing, irresponsible, condomless sex with whatever idea it is you're writing about at the time.
quotes.author: Lady Gaga

quotes.text: The future for me is already a thing of the past -You were my first love and you will be my last
quotes.author: Bob Dylan,  Bob Dylan - Love and Theft: Piano/Vocal/Guitar

quotes.text: If you ever looked at me once with what I know is in you, I would be your slave.
quotes.author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights

quotes.text: My father had taught me to be nice first, because you can always be mean later, but once you've been mean to someone, they won't believe the nice anymore. So be nice, be nice, until it's time to stop being nice, then destroy them.
quotes.author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  A Stroke of Midnight

quotes.text: When each day is the same as the next, it’s because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises.

quotes.text: Every true love and friendship is a story of unexpected transformation. If we are the same person before and after we loved, that means we haven't loved enough.
quotes.author: Elif Shafak,  The Forty Rules of Love

quotes.text: We all know him to be a proud, unpleasant sort of man; but this would be nothing if you really liked him.
quotes.author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice

quotes.text: Religion. It's given people hope in a world torn apart by religion.

quotes.text: There is no reason why the same man should like the same books at eighteen and at forty-eight
quotes.author: Ezra Pound

quotes.text: My mind's my kingdom.

quotes.text: Hope is generally a wrong guide, though it is good company along the way.

quotes.text: You win the victory when you yield to friends.

quotes.text: Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.

quotes.text: True love stories never have endings.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: I'm drawn to the unconventional because I've been drawn unconventionally. I believe that I'm supposed to topple over these false images of what's idealistically beautiful. Because, of course, these intangible qualities are very attractive to women. Sincerity. Sense of humor. Success.

quotes.text: I live making comics. Comics is an industrial art but less suffering, because comics are for young people who are more adventurous. I do that. I live off comics, and then I write books, but when you want movies, you cannot make movies without money.

quotes.text: Why is love intensified by absence?
quotes.author: Audrey Niffenegger,  The Time Traveler's Wife

quotes.text: Doubt everything. Find your own light.
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: The human body is the best work of art.

quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones

quotes.text: After all, what is happiness? Love, they tell me. But love doesn't bring and never has brought happiness. On the contrary, it's a constant state of anxiety, a battlefield; it's sleepless nights, asking ourselves all the time if we're doing the right thing. Real love is composed of ecstasy and agony.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Witch Of Portobello

quotes.text: I love a sunburnt country,A land of sweeping plains,Of ragged mountain ranges,Of droughts and flooding rains.I love her far horizons,I love her jewel-sea,Her beauty and her terror –The wide brown land for me!
quotes.author: Dorothea Mackellar,  The Poems of Dorothea Mackellar

quotes.text: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

quotes.text: If I love you, what business is it of yours?
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: I envy people that know love. That have someone who takes them as they are.

quotes.text: They do not love that do not show their love.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  The Two Gentlemen of Verona

quotes.text: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.

quotes.text: To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul.
quotes.author: Muriel Spark,  The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie

quotes.text: This is what the past is for! Every experience God gives us, every person He puts in our lives is the perfect preparation for the future that only He can see.
quotes.author: Corrie ten Boom,  The Hiding Place

quotes.text: A study in the Washington Post says that women havebetter verbal skills than men. I just want to say to the authors of that study: 'Duh.

quotes.text: You never know how much you really believe anything until its truth or falsehood becomes a matter of life and death to you.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.text: Happiness is not always through success. Equally, the constant pursuit of success is sure unhappiness. But we have to find the balance. My own thoughts are that parenting is very personal. And we all feel enormous insecurity about parenting. What are they going to think of us 20 years down the line?
quotes.author: Amy Chua

quotes.text: To be truly radical is to make hope possible rather than despair convincing.

quotes.text: Never have a companion that casts you in the shade.

quotes.text: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.

quotes.text: Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.text: Women's humor seems to be a little more supportive. It's just kind of trying to make the other one laugh through funny voices and kind of talking about other people. I respond to that. I feel less like I'm going to get beat up in a room full of women than I do in a room full of guys.
quotes.author: Paul Feig

quotes.text: Now, there are so many movies, so many festivals, and so many awards going on, each judged with each other, like your work is worse than others and that's not fair. How can you tell what's best and what's worst from these awards? We're talking about art.
quotes.author: Javier Bardem

quotes.text: A thousand half-loves must be forsaken to take one whole heart home.
quotes.author: Rumi,  Words of Paradise: Selected Poems of Rumi

quotes.text: I have no faith in human perfectibility. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: great writers are indecent peoplethey live unfairlysaving the best part for paper.good human beings save the worldso that bastards like me can keep creating art,become immortal.if you read this after I am deadit means I made it.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski,  The People Look Like Flowers at Last

quotes.text: I have little left in myself -- I must have you. The world may laugh -- may call me absurd, selfish -- but it does not signify. My very soul demands you: it will be satisfied, or it will take deadly vengeance on its frame.

quotes.text: Everyone is a little crazy. The only difference between us and them is that they hide it better.
quotes.author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer

quotes.text: I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today. I can choose which it shall be. Yesterday is dead, tomorrow hasn't arrived yet. I have just one day, today, and I'm going to be happy in it.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx,  The Essential Groucho: Writings For By And About Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Journals of Ralph Waldo Emerson, with Annotations - 1841-1844

quotes.text: The only way to survive eternity is to be able to appreciate each moment.
quotes.author: Lauren Kate,  Fallen

quotes.text: She wasn't doing a thing that I could see, except standing there leaning on the balcony railing, holding the universe together.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.text: Do you know what we call opinion in the absence of evidence? We call it prejudice.
quotes.author: Michael Crichton,  State of Fear

quotes.text: ...unrequited love does not die; it's only beaten down to a secret place where it hides, curled and wounded. For some unfortunates, it turns bitter and mean, and those who come after pay the price for the hurt done by the one who came before.
quotes.author: Elle Newmark,  The Book of Unholy Mischief

quotes.text: We are all the pieces of what we remember. We hold in ourselves the hopes and fears of those who love us. As long as there is love and memory, there is no true loss.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Heavenly Fire

quotes.text: I just can't listen to any more Wagner, you know...I'm starting to get the urge to conquer Poland.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: Give me books, French wine, fruit, fine weather and a little music played out of doors by somebody I do not know.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.text: Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches. Happiness is like a tree going into the sky, and sadness is like the roots going down into the womb of the earth. Both are needed, and the higher a tree goes, the deeper it goes, simultaneously. The bigger the tree, the bigger will be its roots. In fact, it is always in proportion. That's its balance.
quotes.author: Osho,  Everyday Osho: 365 Daily Meditations for the Here and Now

quotes.text: I think you are wrong to want a heart. It makes most people unhappy. If you only knew it, you are in luck not to have a heart.
quotes.author: L. Frank Baum,  The Wonderful Wizard of Oz

quotes.text: Other crack teams get bat boomerangs and wall-climbing powers; we get Aquatruck.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Ashes

quotes.text: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.
quotes.author: Matthew Prior

quotes.text: I'm quite detached from failure and success. Once a shooting is done, I kind of close that chapter in my life.
quotes.author: Ranbir Kapoor

quotes.text: Our best hope for the future is not to get people to think of all humanity as family - that's impossible. It lies, instead, in an appreciation of the fact that, even if we don't empathize with distant strangers, their lives have the same value as the lives of those we love.
quotes.author: Paul Bloom

quotes.text: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
quotes.author: Paul Sweeney

quotes.text: I have such a respect for comedy. It's a lot harder than doing drama, in my opinion; you have to have sort of an innate sense of humor. There are rules to comedy you can learn. But ultimately, it really does require a certain point of view on the world, and that really does appeal to me.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Banks

quotes.text: I just love entertaining. I will do anything - stand-up comedy, video games, fencing, internet shorts - I just want to keep being lucky enough to entertain people anyway I can. I try never to limit my art to a medium.
quotes.author: Matthew Gray Gubler

quotes.text: Do not wait for the last judgment. It comes every day.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: A passport, as I'm sure you know, is a document that one shows to government officials whenever one reaches a border between two countries, so that the official can learn who you are, where you were born, and how you look when photographed unflatteringly.
quotes.author: Lemony Snicket

quotes.text: If complete and utter chaos was lightning, then he'd be the sort to stand on a hilltop in a thunderstorm wearing wet copper armour and shouting 'All gods are bastards!
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett,  The Color of Magic

quotes.text: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure. You have no security unless you can live bravely, excitingly, imaginatively; unless you can choose a challenge instead of competence.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt,  The Autobiography of Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: I want God to play in my bloodstream the way sunlight amuses itself on the water.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: If a man wants you, nothing can keep him away. If he doesn't want you, nothing can make him stay.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: To terrify children with the image of hell, to consider women an inferior creation—is that good for the world?
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quotes.text: Kissing - and I mean like, yummy, smacking kissing - is the most delicious, most beautiful and passionate thing that two people can do, bar none. Better than sex, hands down.
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.text: This generation has lost the true meaning of romance. There are so many songs that disrespect women. You can’t treat the woman you love as a piece of meat. You should treat your love like a princess. Give her love songs, something with real meaning. Maybe I’m old fashioned but to respect the woman you love should be a priority.
quotes.author: Tom Hiddleston

quotes.text: My life didn't please me, so I created my life.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
quotes.author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird

quotes.text: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Why, every time I shut the window I hurt somebody's fingers.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.text: I am my own biggest critic. Before anyone else has criticized me, I have already criticized myself. But for the rest of my life, I am going to be with me and I don't want to spend my life with someone who is always critical. So I am going to stop being my own critic. It's high time that I accept all the great things about me.
quotes.author: C. JoyBell C.

quotes.text: I want to try making things right because picking up the pieces is way better than leaving them the way they are.
quotes.author: Simone Elkeles,  Perfect Chemistry

quotes.text: Let me die the moment my love dies. Let me not outlive my own capacity to love. Let me die still loving, and so, never die.
quotes.author: Mary Zimmerman,  Metamorphoses

quotes.text: When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson,  Fear and Loathing on the Campaign Trail '72

quotes.text: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful.
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: I'm sure I'll feel much more grateful when I find a guy who thinks complex wiring in a girl is a turn-on.
quotes.author: Marissa Meyer,  Cinder

quotes.text: My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: If you love a flower that lives on a star, it is sweet to look at the sky at night. All the stars are a-bloom with flowers...
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

quotes.text: Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Belief creates the actual fact.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.text: Achieve success in any area of life by identifying the optimum strategies and repeating them until they become habits.
quotes.author: Charles J. Givens

quotes.text: I think if there's a great depression there might be some hope.
quotes.author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quotes.text: Mighty proud I am that I am able to have a spare bed for my friends.
quotes.author: Samuel Pepys

quotes.text: But when it came right down to it, the skin of my wrist looked so white and defensless that I couldn't do it. quotes.text: But life is a battle: may we all be enabled to fight it well!

You have become adult.

quotes.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

quotes.text: I hope the BWF (Badminton World Federation) will seriously do something about the Olympic qualifying format or risk getting badminton dropped from the Games.
