quotes.text: As my sufferings mounted I soon realized that there were two ways in which I could respond to my situation -- either to react with bitterness or seek to transform the suffering into a creative force. I decided to follow the latter course.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: I read somewhere... how important it is in life not necessarily to be strong, but to feel strong... to measure yourself at least once.
quotes.author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild

quotes.text: Want to play baseball?’” she asked. Shane’s eyes opened, and he stopped stroking her hair. “What?’” “First base,’” she said. “You’re already there.’” “I’m not running the bases.’” “Well, you could at least steal second.’” “Jeez, Claire. I used to distract myself with sports stats at times like these, but now you’ve gone and ruined it.
quotes.author: Rachel Caine,  The Dead Girls' Dance

quotes.text: Books are a narcotic.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: Nothing is ever certain.
quotes.author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones

quotes.text: The death of a beautiful woman is, unquestionably, the most poetical topic in the world.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: We can destroy what we have written, but we cannot unwrite it.
quotes.author: Anthony Burgess,  A Clockwork Orange

quotes.text: My story of success and failure is not just about music and being famous. It's about living and loving and trying to find purpose in this crazy world.
quotes.author: Wynonna Judd

quotes.text: My approach to cricket has been reasonably simple: it was about giving everything to the team, it was about playing with dignity and it was about upholding the spirit of the game. I hope I have done some of that. I have failed at times, but I have never stopped trying. It is why I leave with sadness but also with pride.
quotes.author: Rahul Dravid

quotes.text: I love the fact that so many of my readers are intelligent, exceptional, accomplished people with an open-minded love of diversity. But even more than that, I love it when my readers find lasting friendship with others of my readers - knowing that they met through their mutual affection for my books and characters makes me happy!
quotes.author: Suzanne Brockmann

quotes.text: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don't let yourself believe it will happen to you.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.text: I want to tell women that you need to love yourself and make yourself a priority. It's only when you are happy yourself, can you make everyone else around you happy. I am still a dreamer and still believe in fairy tales, but there is only that much one should give another person. You need to keep something for yourself.
quotes.author: Bipasha Basu

quotes.text: Dali had a good sense of humor - obviously you could tell just looking at him; he was funny.
quotes.author: Joe Grant

quotes.text: A race is a work of art that people can look at and be affected in as many ways they're capable of understanding.
quotes.author: Steve Prefontaine

quotes.text: It’s the same with people who say, ‘Whatever doesn’t kill you makes you stronger.’ Even people who say this must realize that the exact opposite is true. What doesn’t kill you maims you, cripples you, leaves you weak, makes you whiny and full of yourself at the same time. The more pain, the more pompous you get. Whatever doesn’t kill you makes you incredibly annoying.
quotes.author: Rob Sheffield,  Love Is a Mix Tape

quotes.text: Oh, what a tangled web we weave...when first we practice to deceive.
quotes.author: Walter Scott,  Marmion

quotes.text: Carpe Scrotum. Seize life by the testicles
quotes.author: Rowena Cherry,  Knight's Fork

quotes.text: you're an expert at sorry and keeping the lines blurry
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: Until this moment, I had not realized that someone could break your heart twice, along the very same fault lines.
quotes.author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper

quotes.text: I shiver, thinking how easy it is to be totally wrong about people-to see one tiny part of them and confuse it for the whole, to see the cause and think it's the effect or vice versa
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall

quotes.text: But I have learned that you make your own happiness, that part of going for what you want means losing something else. And when the stakes are high, the losses can be that much greater.
quotes.author: Emily Giffin,  Something Borrowed

quotes.text: If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: Poetry, she thought, wasn't written to be analyzed; it was meant to inspire without reason, to touch without understanding.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

quotes.text: There's gon' be some stuff you gon' seethat's gon' make it hard to smile in the future.But through whatever you see,through all the rain and the pain,you gotta keep your sense of humor.You gotta be able to smile through all this bullshit.Remember that.
quotes.author: Tupac Shakur

quotes.text: Don't cry, I'm sorry to have deceived you so much, but that's how life is.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov,  Lolita

quotes.text: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: HUMAN BEINGS MAKE LIFE SO INTERESTING. DO YOU KNOW, THAT IN A UNIVERSE SO FULL OF WONDERS, THEY HAVE MANAGED TO INVENT BOREDOM. (Death)
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett,  Hogfather

quotes.text: When we give cheerfully and accept gratefully, everyone is blessed.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: This book taught me, once and for all, how easily you can escape this world with the help of words! You can find friends between the pages of a book, wonderful friends.
quotes.author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkspell

quotes.text: 'Perfect' is about a set-up that looks perfect from the outside - beautiful country house, beautiful wife and mother, everything where it should be - and the deep fissures that, in fact, lie beneath that. 'Perfect' was partly a response to the shock of my first book, 'The Unlikely Pilgrimage Of Harold Fry,' being a success.
quotes.author: Rachel Joyce

quotes.text: The great moral powers of the soul are faith, hope, and love.
quotes.author: Ellen G. White

quotes.text: Friendship has its illusions no less than love.
quotes.author: Stendhal

quotes.text: The Internet is so big, so powerful and pointless that for some people it is a complete substitute for life.
quotes.author: Andrew Brown

quotes.text: Through devotion, your family cares become more peaceful, mutual love between husband and wife becomes more sincere, the service we owe to the prince more faithful, and our work, no matter what it is, becomes more pleasant and agreeable.
quotes.author: Saint Francis de Sales

quotes.text: I think there's a little confusion between humor and 'gross' passing for humor. That's kind of regrettable, because they aren't the same thing.
quotes.author: Bob Newhart

quotes.text: The art of the cuisine, when fully mastered, is the one human capability of which only good things can be said.
quotes.author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quotes.text: Then I discovered that being related is no guarantee of love!
quotes.author: Stieg Larsson,  The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

quotes.text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: What about when someone doesn't need a shoulder? What if they need the arms?
quotes.author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quotes.text: Bitch (noun): A woman who won't bang her head against the wall obsessing over someone else's opinion - be it a man or anyone else in her life. She understands that if someone does not approve of her, it's just one person's opinion; therefore, it's of no real importance. She doesn't try to live up to anyone else's standards - only her own. Because of this, she relates to a man very differently.
quotes.author: Sherry Argov,  Why Men Love Bitches: From Doormat to Dreamgirl - A Woman's Guide to Holding Her Own in a Relationship

quotes.text: One of the things Ford Prefect had always found hardest to understand about humans was their habit of continually stating and repeating the very very obvious.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.text: Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless.
quotes.author: Bill Watterson

quotes.text: I should never be left alone with my mind for too long.
quotes.author: Libba Bray

quotes.text: Wait. You think I'm going to die? That's why you slept with me?
quotes.author: Richelle Mead,  Shadow Kiss

quotes.text: Even for me life had its gleams of sunshine.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: You picked a lemon, throw it away lemonade is overrated. Freaks should remain at the circus, not in your apartment. You already have one asshole. You don’t need another. Make a space in your life for the glorious things you deserve. Have faith.
quotes.author: Greg Behrendt,  He's Just Not That Into You: The No-Excuses Truth to Understanding Guys

quotes.text: The love of books is among the choicest gifts of the gods.
quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.text: Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
quotes.author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version

quotes.text: With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not.
quotes.author: Sara Gruen,  Water for Elephants

quotes.text: Memories were fine but you couldn't touch them, smell them or hold them. They were never exactly as the moment was, and they faded with time.
quotes.author: Cecelia Ahern

quotes.text: No matter how bad things are, you can always make things worse.
quotes.author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture

quotes.text: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: You will never be able to escape from your heart. So it's better to listen to what it has to say.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quotes.text: There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies.

quotes.text: The children now love luxury. They have bad manners, contempt for authority; they show disrespect for elders and love chatter in place of exercise.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.text: Faith is about doing. You are how you act, not just how you believe.
quotes.author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story

quotes.text: Men should think twice before making widowhood women's only path to power.
quotes.author: Gloria Steinem

quotes.text: To be a poet is a condition, not a profession.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How can any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It’s beyond me.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.text: Your intuition knows what to write, so get out of the way.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quotes.text: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.
quotes.author: Gautama Buddha

quotes.text: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
quotes.author: Bill Copeland

quotes.text: I had the good fortune of speaking with Orson Wells many decades ago and he said 'Success is primarily luck anyway.' And I have been very lucky. Of course, Orson Wells was enormously talented and brilliant - so who am I to argue with him!
quotes.author: George Kennedy

quotes.text: I have more awareness of other people and, I hope, more sensitivity to their needs. I also find that I'm more direct and outspoken.
quotes.author: Christopher Reeve

quotes.text: When two people first meet, they can only have a very ordinary kind of friendship. But when you begin to understand each other, when you get close to them, you discover that you're suddenly eager to know him or her even better.
quotes.author: Zhang Ziyi

quotes.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: Everything can be killed except nostalgia for the kingdom, we carry it in the color of our eyes, in every love affair, in everything that deeply torments and unties and tricks.
quotes.author: Julio Cortazar

quotes.text: The first glass is for myself, the second for my friends, the third for good humor, and the forth for my enemies.
quotes.author: William Temple

quotes.text: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer. Art is everything else we do.

quotes.text: Some things are hard to write about. After something happens to you, you go to write it down, and either you over dramatize it, or underplay it, exaggerate the wrong parts or ignore the important ones. At any rate, you never write it quite the way you want to.

quotes.text: I took a test in Existentialism. I left all the answers blank and got 100.

quotes.text: If you understand others you are smart.If you understand yourself you are illuminated.If you overcome others you are powerful.If you overcome yourself you have strength.If you know how to be satisfied you are rich.If you can act with vigor, you have a will.If you don't lose your objectives you can be long-lasting.If you die without loss, you are eternal.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching

quotes.text: There is no doubt fiction makes a better job of the truth.
quotes.author: Doris Lessing,  Under My Skin: Volume One of My Autobiography, to 1949

quotes.text: God answers all prayers, but sometimes his answer is 'no'.
quotes.author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

quotes.text: When we face pain in relationships our first response is often to sever bonds rather than to maintain commitment.
quotes.author: bell hooks,  All About Love: New Visions

quotes.text: only someone who is ready for everything, who doesn't exclude any experience, even the most incomprehensible, will live the relationship with another person as something alive and will himself sound the depths of his own being.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet

quotes.text: Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.

quotes.text: Spring passes and one remembers one's innocence.Summer passes and one remembers one's exuberance.Autumn passes and one remembers one's reverence.Winter passes and one remembers one's perseverance.

quotes.author: Charlaine Harris,  Dead to the World

quotes.text: If you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.

quotes.text: It is not despair, for despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt. We do not.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

quotes.text: Our greatest fear should not be of failure but of succeeding at things in life that don't really matter.
quotes.author: Francis Chan,  Crazy Love: Overwhelmed by a Relentless God

quotes.text: You can live to be a hundred if you give up all the things that make you want to live to be a hundred.

quotes.text: Ask me no questions, and I'll tell you no fibs.
quotes.author: Oliver Goldsmith,  She Stoops to Conquer

quotes.text: Life ... is a taleTold by an idiot, full of sound and fury,Signifying nothing.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth

quotes.text: Would he find her?Without question.Would he save her?Always.
quotes.author: Lauren Kate,  Torment

quotes.text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.

quotes.text: Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you secruity and friendship and didn't ask for anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly.

quotes.text: When you go through a hard period,When everything seems to oppose you,... When you feel you cannot even bear one more minute,NEVER GIVE UP!Because it is the time and place that the course will divert!

quotes.text: It must be remembered that the sea is a great breeder of friendship. Two men who have known each other for twenty years find that twenty days at sea bring them nearer than ever they were before, or else estrange them.

quotes.text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.

quotes.text: When I was a kid, I'd practise Chopin on piano - and I love Chopin! He's my dawg! Then I'd go out on the stoop and blast the radio. I'm from New York, the concrete jungle. Hip-hop influenced me from day one.

quotes.text: The total absence of humor from the Bible is one of the most singular things in all literature.

quotes.text: Surrealism: An archaic term. Formerly an art movement. No longer distinguishable from everyday life.

quotes.text: You’re just another story I can’t tell anymore.

quotes.text: When life gives you lemons, chunk it right back.

quotes.text: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.

quotes.text: Make it dark, make it grim, make it tough, but then, for the love of God, tell a joke.

quotes.text: I don't get it,' Caroline said, bemused. 'She's the only one with wings. Why is that?'There were so many questions in life. You couldn't ever have all the answers. But I knew this one.It's so she can fly,' I said. Then I started to run.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever

quotes.text: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.

quotes.text: My candle burns at both ends;It will not last the night;But ah, my foes, and oh, my friends—It gives a lovely light!

quotes.text: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.

quotes.text: But grief makes a monster out of us sometimes . . . and sometimes you say and do things to the people you love that you can't forgive yourself for.

quotes.text: We know that God is everywhere; but certainly we feel His presence most when His works are on the grandest scale spread before us; and it is in the unclouded night-sky, where His worlds wheel their silent course, that we read clearest His infinitude, His omnipotence, His omnipresence.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: Human decency is not derived from religion. It precedes it.

quotes.text: Forgiveness is the name of love practiced among people who love poorly. The hard truth is that all people love poorly. We need to forgive and be forgiven every day, every hour increasingly. That is the great work of love among the fellowship of the weak that is the human family.
quotes.author: Henri J.M. Nouwen

quotes.text: He did not care if she was heartless, vicious and vulgar, stupid and grasping, he loved her. He would rather have misery with one than happiness with the other.

quotes.text: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.

quotes.text: How is it possible to have a civil war?

quotes.text: No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books.

quotes.text: Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow.

quotes.text: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.

quotes.text: In bed that night I invented a special drain that would be underneath every pillow in New York, and would connect to the reservoir. Whenever people cried themselves to sleep, the tears would all go to the same place, and in the morning the weatherman could report if the water level of the Reservoir of Tears had gone up or down, and you could know if New York is in heavy boots.
quotes.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quotes.text: How many observe Christ's birthday! How few, His precepts!

quotes.text: It does good to no woman to be flattered [by a man] who does not intend to marry her; and it is madness in all women to let a secret love kindle within them, which, if unreturned and unknown, must devour the life that feeds it; and, if discovered and responded to, must lead, ignis-fatuus-like, into miry wilds whence there is no extrication.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

quotes.text: When things go wrong, don't go with them.

quotes.text: If I ever meet myself,' said Zaphod, 'I'll hit myself so hard I won't know what's hit me.

quotes.text: You must admit I have a right to live in a pigsty if I want.
quotes.author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Howl's Moving Castle

quotes.text: If you need something from somebody always give that person a way to hand it to you.
quotes.author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees

quotes.text: No truth can cure the sorrow we feel from losing a loved one. No truth, no sincerity, no strength, no kindness can cure that sorrow. All we can do is see it through to the end and learn something from it, but what we learn will be no help in facing the next sorrow that comes to us without warning.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami,  Norwegian Wood

quotes.text: Education is a fundamental principle of what made America a success. We can't afford to throw any young people away.

quotes.text: In love, unlike most other passions, the recollection of what you have had and lost is always better than what you can hope for in the future.

quotes.text: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.

quotes.text: The things that drive me are poverty, and pain, and knowing that I don't want to end up being alone and I want to do something with my life and I want the name Dobson to remain in everyone's heads. Basically, just to rock and be the best performer I can be, and be true, and be real, and give people the real Fefe, nothing fake, all real.

It would be a mindfreak and so that's why I came up with that. But, many people say I'm really a student of humanity and psychology.

quotes.text: Home wasn't a set house, or a single town on a map. It was wherever the people who loved you were, whenever you were together. quotes.text: When someone died in the wilderness of frontier America, that person's physical remains were buried and the handcarts continued west, but the mourning survivors had hope for their loved one's eternal soul. However, when someone dies spiritually in the wilderness of sin, hope may be replaced by dread and fear for the loved one's eternal welfare.

quotes.text: I make fun of situations and try and find the humor in things, but it's never at the expense of the other guy.

quotes.text: There's a snobbery at work in architecture. The subject is too often treated as a fine art, delicately wrapped in mumbo-jumbo. In reality, it's an all-embracing discipline taking in science, art, maths, engineering, climate, nature, politics, economics.

quotes.text: You should try not to talk so much, friend. You'll sound far less stupid that way.- Breeze
quotes.author: Brandon Sanderson,  Mistborn: The Final Empire

quotes.text: If Jesus came back and saw what was being done in his name, he'd never stop throwing up.

quotes.text: He is free to evade reality, he is free to unfocus his mind and stumble blindly down any road he pleases, but not free to avoid the abyss he refuses to see.

quotes.text: I try to stay in a constant state of confusion just because of the expression it leaves on my face.

quotes.text: That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment.

quotes.text: We’d met at a carefree time, a moment full of promise, in its place now were the harsh lessons of the real world.

quotes.author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quotes.text: Don't loaf and invite inspiration; light out after it with a club.

quotes.text: You can fix anything but a blank page.

quotes.text: No one here gets out alive.

quotes.text: When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.

quotes.text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.I wish you all very good lives.

quotes.text: It wasn’t my day. My week. My month. My year. My life. God damn it.

quotes.text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

quotes.text: It's better to die laughing than to live each moment in fear.

quotes.text: Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them.
quotes.author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays

quotes.text: There are never enough 'I love you's.

quotes.text: We who think we are about to die will laugh at anything.

quotes.text: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.

quotes.text: Success in training the boy depends largely on the Scoutmaster's own personal example.

quotes.text: I had in mind a message, although I hope it doesn't intrude too badly, persuading Americans, and especially Southerners, of the critical importance of land and our vanishing natural environment and wildlife.

quotes.text: During the 1950s, Aristotle Onassis and I formed what grew to be a close friendship and association in several business ventures.
quotes.author: J. Paul Getty

quotes.text: The greatest legacy one can pass on to one's children and grandchildren is not money or other material things accumulated in one's life, but rather a legacy of character and faith.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.text: I have a very silly sense of humor. I've never laughed harder in my entire life than seeing someone with toilet paper stuck on the bottom of their shoe.
quotes.author: Paula Poundstone

quotes.text: The whole art of war consists of guessing at what is on the other side of the hill.
quotes.author: Arthur Wellesley

quotes.text: Who are you?Are you in touch with all of your darkest fantasies?Have you created a life for yourself where you can experience them?I have. I am fucking crazy.But I am free.
quotes.author: Lana Del Rey

quotes.text: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden

quotes.text: Of course he loves me. I’m his sister.”“Blood isn’t love,” said Magnus, and his voice was bitter.
quotes.author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Lost Souls

quotes.text: For beauty is nothing but the beginning of terrorwhich we are barely able to endure, and it amazes us so,because it serenely disdains to destroy us.Every angel is terrible.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Duino Elegies

quotes.text: I imagine hell like this: Italian punctuality, German humour and English wine.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.text: Happiness is a risk. If you’re not a little scared, then you’re not doing it right.

quotes.text: Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.text: The stars are not wanted now: put out every one;Pack up the moon and dismantle the sun;Pour away the ocean and sweep up the wood.For nothing now can ever come to any good.
quotes.author: W.H. Auden,  Selected Poems

quotes.text: Moral wounds have this peculiarity - they may be hidden, but they never close; always painful, always ready to bleed when touched, they remain fresh and open in the heart.
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

quotes.text: I love you enough to never make you choose.
quotes.author: Katie McGarry,  Pushing the Limits

quotes.text: Get up, stand up, Stand up for your rights. Get up, stand up, Don't give up the fight.

quotes.text: We are the music-makers,And we are the dreamers of dreams,Wandering by lone sea-breakers,And sitting by desolate streams.World-losers and world-forsakers,Upon whom the pale moon gleams;Yet we are the movers and shakers,Of the world forever, it seems.
quotes.author: Arthur O'Shaughnessy,  Poems of Arthur O'Shaughnessy

quotes.text: Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own.
quotes.author: Joss Whedon

quotes.text: The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.[These words are also inscribed upon his grave]
quotes.author: Karl Marx,  Eleven Theses on Feuerbach

quotes.text: Deep grief sometimes is almost like a specific location, a coordinate on a map of time. When you are standing in that forest of sorrow, you cannot imagine that you could ever find your way to a better place. But if someone can assure you that they themselves have stood in that same place, and now have moved on, sometimes this will bring hope
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love

quotes.text: There is not enough love and goodness in the world to permit giving any of it away to imaginary beings.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Human, All Too Human

quotes.text: All that I hope to say in books, all that I ever hope to say, is that I love the world.
quotes.author: E.B. White

quotes.text: I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quotes.text: The Queen's Pride was his ship, and he loved her. (That was the way his sentences always went: It is raining today and I love you. My cold is better and I love you. Say hello to Horse and I love you. Like that.)
quotes.author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride

quotes.text: All human beings have three lives: public, private, and secret.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Gabriel García Márquez: a Life

quotes.text: If I can see pain in your eyes then share with me your tears. If I can see joy in your eyes then share with me your smile.
quotes.author: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.text: Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses.
quotes.author: Alphonse Karr,  A Tour Round My Garden

quotes.text: You lead with direction, and you try to lead by example. I try to be there when things are not good and obviously share the spoils of success.

quotes.text: We need to be smarter than our smart phones and realize the people we are with are more important than the people we aren't with, and way more important than the strangers we hope will tweet and like and share and Instagram whatever we're sending out into the cybersphere.

quotes.text: I think in friendship, you want to be there for your friend, and sometimes you just don't know what to do or the relationship you have with them is not clear enough for you to know what to do.
quotes.author: Marion Cotillard

quotes.text: Don't get me wrong, I admire elegance and have an appreciation of the finer things in life. But to me, beauty lies in simplicity.

quotes.text: As in all matters involving love, which has so many different meanings, you find that the feeling that we label 'love' is not a simple feeling, it's a very complex one. Under the heading 'love' can come all sorts of rage and desperation.

quotes.text: I want to have fun. Life ain't no dress rehearsal. I want to have fun. I'm a comedian; I ain't no politician. So everything I do is with humor, with love.

quotes.text: Just as the development of earth art and installation art stemmed from the idea of taking art out of the galleries, the basis of my involvement with public art is a continuation of wall drawings.

quotes.text: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.

quotes.text: My parents danced together, her head on his chest. Both had their eyes closed. They seemed so perfectly content. If you can find someone like that, someone who you can hold and close your eyes to the world with, then you're lucky. Even if it only lasts for a minute or a day. The image of them gently swaying to the music is how I picture love in my mind even after all these years.
quotes.author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind

quotes.text: True love begins when nothing is looked for in return.

quotes.text: I drive around the streetsan inch away from weeping,ashamed of my sentimentality andpossible love.

quotes.text: Life before Death.Strength before Weakness.Journey before Destination.

quotes.text: The pain I feel now is the happiness I had before. That's the deal.

quotes.text: Hope.It's like a drop of honey, a field of tulips blooming in the springtime. It's a fresh rain, a whispered promise, a cloudless sky, the perfect punctuation mark at the end of a sentence. And it's the only thing in the world keeping me afloat.

quotes.text: There's nothing wrong with you. There's a lot wrong with the world you live in. And definitely get out of high school and make everyone sorry.

quotes.text: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it.

Fear of getting failing grades, fear of not staying with your class, etc. Interest can produce learning on a scale compared to fear as a nuclear explosion to a firecracker.

quotes.text: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.

And the worst part is, if you go bohemian or something crazy like that, you're conforming just as much only in a different way.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger,  Franny and Zooey

You’re the only guy I’ve ever had the urge to lick.” He smiles at me confidently. “Good. Because you’re the only girl I’ve ever had the urge to love.

quotes.author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quotes.text: I love people who dress how they feel and change it depending on the day.

quotes.text: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.

quotes.text: I'm nobody! Who are you? Are you nobody, too? Then there ’s a pair of us—don’t tell! They ’d banish us, you know. How dreary to be somebody! How public, like a frog To tell your name the livelong day To an admiring bog!
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems

quotes.text: Fools have a habit of believing that everything written by a famous author is admirable. For my part I read only to please myself and like only what suits my taste.

quotes.text: A man in love can do extraordinary things, I don’t care if you’re an angel, you’re my angel, and I won’t let you go.

quotes.text: Don't ever think I fell for you, or fell over you. I didn't fall in love, I rose in it.

quotes.text: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.

quotes.text: Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.

quotes.text: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: No man is poor who has a Godly mother.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Well done is better than well said.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: As I am sure you know, when people say 'It's my pleasure,' they usually mean something along the lines of, 'There's nothing on Earth I would rather do less.' [...]

If people give you a hard time and tell you to get your nose out of a book, tell them you're working. Tell them it's research. Tell them to pipe down and leave you alone.

quotes.text: This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.

quotes.text: A great nose may be an indexOf a great soul

quotes.text: Terrific. A bisexual dominant vampire with kidnapping expertise.
quotes.author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Unbound

quotes.text: Practice makes perfect, but nobody's perfect, so why practice?

quotes.text: I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.

To model and demonstrate the kind of world you demand to live in. To write the books. Make the music. Shoot the films. Paint the art.

quotes.text: Personal satisfaction is the most important ingredient of success.

quotes.text: I doubt I'll be singing forever, because at some point people aren't going to want to hear my music, and I hope that I'll still get the opportunity to write songs.

quotes.text: I rise to taste the dawn, and find that love alone will shine today.

quotes.text: Before you were born, your parents weren't as boring as they are now. So before you save the rain forest from the parasites of your parent's generation, try delousing the closet in your own room.

quotes.text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

quotes.text: That was the funniest thing I'd heard in days.You're kidding, right? PLEASE tell me you have a stronger motive for me than 'fair is fair.' Life isn't FAIR, Dean....Nothing is fair, EVER. That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard. I need to help you because FAIR IS FAIR? Try, 'I need you to help me so I won't rip out your spine and beat you with it.' I MIGHT respond to that. MAYBE.

quotes.text: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. quotes.text: You're alive, Bod. That means you have infinite potential. You can do anything, make anything, dream anything. If you can change the world, the world will change. Potential. quotes.text: what a luxury it was for people to hold their loved ones whenever they wanted
quotes.author: Cecelia Ahern,  P.S. I Love You

quotes.text: Even if there is only one possible unified theory, it is just a set of rules and equations. What is it that breathes fire into the equations and makes a universe for them to describe? Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?

quotes.text: Yes, the long war on Christianity. I pray that one day we may live in an America where Christians can worship freely! In broad daylight! Consecutively.

quotes.text: I like the scientific spirit—the holding off, the being sure but not too sure, the willingness to surrender ideas when the evidence is against them: this is ultimately fine—it always keeps the way beyond open—always gives life, thought, affection, the whole man, a chance to try over again after a mistake—after a wrong guess.

quotes.text: I've been saying it so long to you, you just wouldn't listen. Every time you said 'Farm Boy do this' you thought I was answering 'As you wish' but that's only because you were hearing wrong. 'I love you' was what it was, but you never heard.

quotes.text: He f**ks even better than he looks”, I settled on saying. Several heads turned. I didn’t care; I was pissed. “And that beautiful face is going to be clamped between my legs as soon as we get home, don’t you worry.

quotes.text: Positivity is such a high predicator of success rates.

quotes.text: It's sad when you can't make everyone happy, though. It's impossible but, at the same time, you still hope. You think, 'Maybe I can do it,' but you know you can't. quotes.text: You've got to reach a hand of friendship across the aisle and across philosophies in this country.

quotes.text: I love Amsterdam. The city is vibrant and alive. It's fresh and so open. It's definitely one of my favorite places.

quotes.text: If our destiny stems from our name, then I weep for the flower named Wilt.

quotes.text: And if there were a God, I think it very unlikely that He would have such an uneasy vanity as to be offended by those who doubt His existence

quotes.text: Grand. There's a word I really hate. It's a phony. I could puke every time I hear it.

quotes.text: I want to go to sleep in my time machine and wake up eight hours in the future.

quotes.text: A friend of mine once defined love as finding someone you can talk to late into the night

quotes.text: She cast her fragrance and her radiance over me. I ought never to have run away from her... I ought to have guessed all the affection that lay behind her poor little stratagems. Flowers are so inconsistent! But I was too young to know how to love her...

Maybe... if I'd said, 'I'm so afraid of losing something I love that I refuse to love anything,' maybe that would have made the impossible possible. Maybe, but I couldn't do it, I had buried too much too deeply inside me. And here I am, instead of there.

quotes.text: But you can't make people listen. They have to come round in their own time, wondering what happened and why the world blew up around them. It can't last.

quotes.text: Statistically speaking, there is a 65 percent chance that the love of your life is having an affair. Be very suspicious.

quotes.text: the time is always right to do the right thing
